Individual Studies in Functional Physiology and Fitness of Skeletal Muscle
This course is designed to develop and enhance the student’s knowledge and detailed understanding of the field of muscle physiology and responses to exercise. The course focuses on the relationship between cellular structure/function, muscle tissue histology/organization and the functional properties of skeletal muscle as it impacts muscle performance in both normal and pathological situations. In addition, the training effects of long-term exercise on muscle physiological and biochemical changes will be discuss as well.

Motor Learning and Control
Motor behavior has emerged as a new discipline in kinesiology/physical education, psychology, and neuroscience. The birth of this new area in kinesiology/physical education can be traced back to the Adams’ closed-loop theory in 1971 and Keele’s influential paper published in 1968. The purpose of the course is to introduce the emerging discipline, which can help students to understand the nature and implications of motor behavior.

Individual Studies in Respiratory and Circulation
The purpose of this course is to promote students’ understanding of the structure and function of the respiratory and circulatory systems (RC systems). 01
Horticultural Therapy
近年來輔助治療越來越重要，富士康的跳樓事件、大學生的自殺事件、弱勢者的生心理重建等，甚或醫護人員、心理諮商師、社工師、以及各類型的照護人員例如老人失智及罕見疾病的家屬等，他們的工作環境充滿壓力。因此園藝治療及接觸庭園的活動對於人的生心理健康有不可忽視的力量。園藝治療簡單來說，就是利用接近植物以及庭園活動來得到不良行為的改善、生理及心理上的健康。園藝治療是強調園藝栽培的過程中所得到的精神及生理上的利益。園藝治療課程的編排最有效的方法包括能快速見到成效的種子繁殖或蔬菜種植; 具有簡單重複步驟可循的無性繁殖; 戶外活動如澆水、施肥、修剪、拔雜草等; 以及和植物有關的設計課程，例如組合盆栽、組合擺盆、插花、壓花卡片、乾燥花、花束、花袋、景觀攝影、植物繪畫、植栽設計等。總而言之就是針對要治療的對象先做需求及工作能力分析後，訂定目標，然後藉由園藝活動來達成目標。例如一個手部不方便中風的人，不要在冰冷的室內物理機器做復健，取而到戶外來種植她想吃的菜，然後透過戶外播種、澆水、除雜草、鬆土一樣可以得到效果，且吃到自己種的蔬菜獲得滿足及自信感，最重要的是不要讓病患覺得自己在治病，因此只要自家有可以照光的陽台便可以做居家照護。本所學生如果訓練基本的園藝治療能力更可以對自己及對患者都有加分作用。
Human relate to plants. That is the basis for therapeutic landscape design (being) and horticultural therapy (doing). Horticultural therapy is designed for children, for those with physical disabilities, for patients with Down’s syndrome, Alzheimer’s disease , for the elderly, for those with genetically illnesses and their families, and for prison inmates. They are large or small, fully accessible or only for viewing, and for day and night use. Their value lies in the positive associations people have with plants.
This course tells you the theory of horticultural therapy, healing landscape and the techniques of how to set up a therapeutic garden and horticultural operations.
    This is the unique course opened that mentioned about the horticultural therpay in Taiwan’s universities and colleges, and extremely fun.
全18週

Issues and Ethics in the Counseling Professions
諮商助人專業有其專業的倫理守則，以規範及維繫諮商服務的專業品質，並保護案主的福祉。成為諮商助人工作者除了必須恰如其分地運用專業知能協助案主外，同時在面對案主各種複雜多元的處境與問題，所產生之不同的倫理情境或議題時，諮商心理師須要有足夠的能力予以辨識、判斷和因應處理。本課程旨在培養學生了解諮商專業的倫理守則與相關法規，並訓練學生對於諮商場境中常有的倫理實務議題，進行思辯與討論，以奠定日後從事諮商專業工作時的專業倫理素養與因應能力。
Counseling profession has its professional ethics in order to protect clients’ welfare and to provide better services, as well as to sustain the quality of counseling profession. To become a professional counselor, students must learn professional knowledge and skills very well, and at the same time, they have to learn how to deal with various difficult ethical dilemmas or issues in different counseling situations. Therefore, this course aims at teaching students:
1.	to understand counseling professional ethical codes and related laws.
2.	to explore and to discuss different ethical issues in many counseling situations.   
3.	to develop professional ability to deal with counseling ethical issues.
全18週

Counseling Practicum(1)
學生修習悲傷輔導專題、諮商與心理治療理論、諮商技術與實務專題研究、團體諮商專題研究等課程後，應透過實際進入輔導機構實習過程，以觀摩學習和實地操練的參與方式，學習對輔導對象提供個別諮商、團體諮商工作方式，增進對諮商工作的體認與專業能力。
本課程目標有三，一是在加強學生諮商實務能力，要求學生在諮商督導協助下，實際進入臨床實習情境進行個案諮商。學生要能針對個案問題及需求進行個案問題分析並選擇合宜策略以擬定諮商計劃，進而實際對個案進行諮商晤談，以其有效協助個案解決問題，增進學生諮商效能。
二是針對失落議題的悲傷輔導與諮商，亦能在實習過程中，獲得實務練習，增進悲傷諮商的知能與技術。
三是運用團體諮商的原理和技巧，強化學生的團體諮商實務能力。在督導協助下實際進行結構式團體的設計與帶領，以期有效協助團體成員因應其問題，從而增進實習學生帶領團體的諮商實際效能。
The course aims to enhance students’ ability to practice counseling under supervision. Furthermore, students will learn to assist clients’ solving their life difficulties by actually counseling clients.

01
Trend of Global Tourism
觀光環境變革日遽，近年來，觀光發展大致呈現三大趨勢，即新觀光旅遊地(New Destinations)的不斷興起、觀光型態的多樣化(Diversification of Tourism)，以及觀光旅遊地競爭激烈(Increasing Competition Between Destinations)。因此，本課程主要以三大部份協助學生瞭解全球觀光變遷趨勢。首先，藉由觀光旅遊競爭力報告，協助學生了解全球各國觀光競爭力的消長；其次，從旅遊活動多元型態的結合，如會展產業、生態旅遊、醫療觀光、Long Stay等，瞭解觀光型態的發展趨勢；最後，從社會現象的觀察，如人口趨勢、資訊科技、健康觀念、休閒生活型態、M型社會、環境倫理、消費文化等，探索觀光旅遊發展現象。
The trends of tourism are changing rapidly in the recent years. There are three trends raised, 1) the continuing expansion of new destinations, 2) the diversification of tourism, and 3) the increasing competition between destinations. Therefore, three aspects are set in this course; first, lead students to understand the growth and decline of global tourism by the official tourism competition reports. Second, lead students to realize the trends by the events of the integrations of multi-type tourisms, for instances, the MICE (Meeting, Incentive, Conferences and Exhibitions) industry, ecotourism, medical tourism, long stay, etc. Third, from the observation of the social phenomenon to explore the development of tourism trends, for instances, the population growth, information technology, healthy concept, leisure life style, M-type society, environmental ethics, consumer culture, creative cultural enterprises, etc.
全18週

Seminar in Travel Safety
本課程旨在闡明觀光旅遊與安全、健康相關之管理及議題，俾使學習者對其有所了解與體認。學習者將透過課程講授、分組報告與交互討論，研討觀光旅遊安全、健康相關管理之概念、原則與方法。本課程也輔導研究生在進行旅遊規畫時，對旅遊者身、心及旅遊目的地有關之食、醫、住、行、育、樂、政、治、氣、人之管理，期能結合理論與實務，培養相關核心能力，以為爾後進入觀光旅遊與安全、健康有關職場之經營管理、指導、教育訓練以及研究等之準備。
This gateway course globally highlights the overall figure of assessment and management on tourism and travel safety. Through the lectures and discussions, the students would approach the concepts, principles and management practices on safety assessment in tourism and travel The scope of this course, based on the management related to tourism and travel safety, will cover the scope of food and beverage, lodging, transportation, entertainment, education and training, and other factors like political situation, climate change, or destination security.

Seminar in travel medicine and health
本課程旨在從旅遊醫學之角度闡明廣泛性之旅遊休閒與健康相關之總體概念，俾使學習者對其有所了解與體認。學習者將透過課程講授、分組報告與交互討論，研討旅遊休閒與健康相關之理念、模式、價值、原則與方法，以及了解旅遊休閒對健康之正負面效應。本課程也輔導研究生就現行旅遊健康議題加以討論，以為爾後進入旅遊休閒與健康有關職場之經營管理、指導、教育訓練以及研究等預作準備。
This gateway course intentionally and extensionally highlights the overall & general figure of travel medicine and the impact on health. Through facilitating lectures and discussions, the learners could approach the concepts, values, principles and methods of the above topics, and increasingly understand the effects of travel and leisure toward health. Alongside, this course provides the students with a discussion on the current popular topics of health and tourism, and thus fulfills the one of the objectives of integrating theory and practice which is helpful in future studies and research for the students.

Research Methodology
本課程旨在使學生熟悉社會科學及健康科學研究法，以涵養學生解決問題的科學態度、具備批判性思考能力以及研究能力。內容包括：研究問題意識產生包含分析各種典範及理論、擬定研究主題、文獻收集、研究設計、資料收集、資料分析及撰寫研究報告等一系列之研究流程，引導並加強學生的研究倫理維護與論文撰寫能力。
This course provides an advanced understanding to the research process, and covers statistical measurement concepts, various types of research, including quantitative and qualitative research, and how to prepare reports. Scientific attitude, critical thinking, and research ability are expected through this educational process.

Independent Study
本課程旨在使學生獲得執行獨立研究之能力。課程中，學生須與任課老師針對碩士論文有關之議題訂正進度報告及討論以達成學習目標。以漸進的方式導引學生，使學生能了解論文計畫之撰寫方式，並朝正確之方向閱讀相關文獻。透過個別討論、團體討論、學習及報告，確立研究問題，組織文獻考查，設計研究可行之研究方法。學生藉由討論與主題相關的課題以增進研究實務能力。
The purpose of this course is to assist student’s independent research ability in preparing the related issue of master thesis. The students enrolling this class are expected to make progress report and have discussion with the advisor in order to reach the learning goal. Teach students how to present a well-done dissertation with systematically research approaches and related references. The purpose of this course is to promote students’ capacity to design a research proposal. Students will be able to apply research knowledge and formulate a research proposal through individual and group discussion and assignments. Students will be able to identify a research problem, organize relevant literature, and design a feasible method for their study.

Research in leisure Psycholog
隨著休閒產業日漸擴大的需求，相關休閒產業的行銷者為使行銷活動有效地執行，則必須先瞭解休閒活動中的消費者如何進行休閒中的消費決策。因此，休閒行為可以說是設計、促銷、銷售休閒產品與行銷活動之基礎。本課程幫助學生瞭解消費者的休閒行為模式，選擇目標顧客群，針對休閒顧客的心理，來了解消費者的需求，而設計產品與服務，並且探索購買的動機。
The teaching objective of this course is to enable students to understand the basic theory of leisure psychology. Through this course, through compulsory classes, classroom discussions and some necessary exercises, students gain knowledge about leisure psychology, management of the leisure industry, and the psychological needs of tourists during leisure.

Customer Relationship Management Research

Finally, the lessons provide a lot of tourism and hospitality cases where students could learn CRM skills and knowledge.

Advanced Biostatistics
本課程旨在教授學生具有高等生物統計學的分析能力。強調生物統計學於健康照護臨床研究的應用，本課程以奠定學生具有資料收集、資料分析及統計報表解讀之能力，同時有能力評值學術期刊所發表的文章。課程內容包括：複習初階統計學之基本概念、連續資料數的統計分析(t 檢定、變異數分析、線性複迴歸、相關分析、重複測量變異數分析)、非連續資料數的統計分析、無母數統計分析等，並將教導學生撰寫程式語言，以培育學生在研究上的統計概念。
This course is designed for graduate students who have basic knowledge on biostatistics. Emphases are on basic understanding of biostatistics and its applications in the research. The course also covers some advanced statistical methods which are commonly used in the research addition to the knowledge of statistical methodology, the course puts emphasis on building up practical skill on statistical analysis and interpreting the results. Sessions include lectures and small workshops for discussion. The course aims to teach health care researchers the essential elements of research methodology and statistics.

本課程旨在提供學生認識老化概念與常見健康議題、老化理論於高齡健康照護領域之應用。課程內容包括全球與台灣的高齡者健康現況、老化概念、生物科學/行為科學/社會科學/心理社會發展等老化理論於高齡照護之臨床實務與研究之應用。本課程藉由講述法、討論法、文獻導讀與分析，使學生能熟悉老化概念，並應用相關老化理論於高齡健康照護議題，進而提升高齡健康整體照護之能力。
This course aims to provide students with an understanding of the concept of aging and common health issues, and the application of aging theory in the field of health care for the elderly. The course contents include the global and Taiwan health status of the elderly, the concept of aging, the application of aging theories such as bioscience /behavioral science / social Science / sychosocial development in clinical practice and research of elderly care. Lecture and discussion will be used as the teaching strategies to improve the ability of overall health care for the elderly.
全18週

01
Integrated Dementia Care
本課程旨在提供學生認識以人為本的全人照護核心理念於失智照護領域之應用。課程內容包括失智症整合式照護模式與應用、失智症預防策略、失智症症狀處置與照護、失智症照顧者照顧困境與處置、分析與批判各類失智症照護之研究論文。本課程藉由講述法、討論法、研究論文導讀與分析，瞭解於失智症照護研究議題之應用，以提升學生失智照護之臨床實務能力。
This course aims to provide students with an understanding of the core concept of people-oriented holistic care and its application in the field of dementia care. The course contents include integrated health care model and application for the dementia, prevention strategy of dementia, treatment and care of dementia symptoms, care difficulties and management of caregivers with dementia, and analysis and criticism of research papers on dementia care. Lecture and discussion will be used as the teaching strategies to improve students' ability in dementia care.
全18週

01
Humanities, Technology, and Aging Society
本課程旨在培養學生思辨科技導入對高齡者健康照護的影響與效益之能力。課程內容關切使用者經驗，主題包括科技對高齡者的生活品質、健康管理、醫療照護行為、與服務使用行為等影響，以及科技應用對高齡者心理健康和社會參與的效益。期待學生能從不同角度探討智慧科技與數位醫療帶來的價值與挑戰，為未來導入智慧科技於高齡照護的方向奠定基礎。
This course aims to cultivate students' critical thinking on the impact and benefits of technology introduction on the health care of the elderly. The content focuses on user experience, and topics include the impact of technology on the quality of life, health management, health care behavior, and service utilization, as well as the benefits of technology application on the mental health and social participation of the elderly. It is expected that students can analyze and evaluate the value and challenges brought by technology and digital medicine from different perspectives, and lay the foundation for the future direction of introducing smart technology into elderly care.

Innovation Management in Elderly Industry
本課程旨在探討面對高齡化與全球快速變化的時代，高齡事業必須更重視創新管理活動，並藉由有效的管理創新活動，達成企業永續經營的目標。本課程設計結合「高齡產業」、「創新」與「管理」三大元素，涵蓋高齡事業的創新能力、創新策略與創新執行過程等議題的探討。藉由課程上的互動與創新議題的探索，啟發同學對創新有不同思考與對創新管理的理解。希望修習本課程後，同學具備創新管理的思維。
This course aims to discuss that in the age of aging and the era of rapid global change, senior businesses must pay more attention to innovation management activities, and achieve the goal of sustainable business management through effective management of innovation activities.Combining the three elements of "elderly industry", "innovation" and "management", this course covers topics such as innovation ability, innovation strategy and innovation implementation process of elderly enterprises.Through the interaction in the course and the exploration of innovation topics, students are inspired to think differently about innovation and understand innovation management.It is hoped that the students have the thinking of innovative management and can apply what they have learned in the course to service innovation in the workplace and elderly industries.

Organization Analysis
本課程旨在協助不同領域之研究生，獲得健康照護體系內相關機構之組織與管理的理論與技能及其應用。課程內容以組織理論為基礎，以管理的功能：規劃、組織、領導、控制及人、財、物、資源管理之矩陣為架構，介紹相關主題 (例如，組織管理理論、衛生政策與醫療照護體系、組織目標與計畫之訂定原則、預算及成本的概念、組織結構、人力資源的管理、參與決策、品質管制等)之理論面與實務面。使學生能對健康照護體系相關之組織與管理有一完整概要的認識，以開發自己的管理潛能
This course is designed to provide multidisciplinary students with in-depth knowledge and skills in organization and management theories and practices of health care organizations. Class discussions will be focused on the application of management principles and techniques in problem solving and decision making in a management matrix of four major management functions—namely planning, organizing, leading, and controlling of health care organizations, plus manager’s responsibilities in managing people, finance, material, and resources management. Major topics will be introduced, such as organizational theories of management, health care policy and system, organizational goals and planning, budget and cost, human resource management, decision making, and quality management. Students are expected to learn a complete knowledge in relating to management of health care organizations. Based on the training of this course, managerial potential of students will be inspired.

Advanced Applied Statistics
本課程旨在增進學生詮釋與應用健康科學相關之進階統計方法，並協助學生具體分辨各種統計檢定方法的適用時機，輔以相關健康議題之文獻閱讀討論及高等統計軟體實務資料之操作，以淺顯易懂方式作圖表呈現及解釋。課程內容除敘述統計學的複習外，將著重於推論統計學的變異數分析、迴歸及相關分析、邏輯斯迴歸分析、其他實用統計分析。
The objective of this course is to provide students with advanced methods of applied statistics in order for students to distinguish appropriate hypothesis tests of analyzing the health related research effectively. Students are trained to discuss and calculate real data examples of homework and to read journal papers. They are expected to have ability to communicate with statisticians, and have creative and logical thinking. Subjects taught in this course include (1) general concepts of applied statistics, (2) descriptive statistics, (3) analysis of variance (ANOVA) (F tests), (4) simple regression analysis and correlation, (5) multiple regression analysis and correlation, (6) chi-square tests, (7) logistic regression analysis. Other related topics will also be introduced.

Health Economics
本課程內容主要分為二部份，第一部份先介紹個體經濟學的理論與方法； 第二部份係運用第一部份所介紹的理論與方法，進一步對健康經濟有關的幾個重 要課題，例如健康照護之需求理論、生產理論、醫師行為、醫院行為、長期照護 產業、醫藥產業及政府管制等，加以分析與解釋。
The course aims to help the students to learn the essential concepts and techniques in microeconomics. Second, the students will be provided with the economic theories of health care market, including the demand for health care, the provider behavior (both physician behavior and hospital behavior) and the market structure in health care industry. Lastly, the class will discuss the rationales of government intervention in health care market and how the government acts in the market.

Internet of Things on Health Care
本課程將以健康照護發展為基礎，藉由實務案例製作及分享，讓學生了解產業及發展現況，並學習相關科技應用，物聯網技術知識，透過健康照護與物聯網之間的串聯，創造專業與實務結合的課程宗旨。課程中將積極引導學生進入健康照護世界，迅速導引學生進入本學門基礎概念，讓學生透過健康照護相關實務案例、實作解析，培養學生不同發展目標，並藉由物聯網專案作品設計，發揮學生創意、創新，創造三者誕生全新的健康照護物聯網應用。
This course will be based on the development of health care, through the production and sharing of practical cases, so that students can understand the industry and its current development, and learn about the application of related technologies and Internet of Things technology. The course will actively guide students to enter the world of health care, quickly guide students to the basic concepts of the discipline, and allow students to develop different development goals through practical cases and practical analysis of health care, and through the design of Internet of Things projects, give full play to students' creativity and innovation, and create new health care Internet of Things applications.

Basic probability theory, parametric statistics, correlation, regression, ANOVA, non-parametric statistics along with computer package practice such as SPSS will be introduced.

01
Methodology in Epidemiology
流行病學為公共衛生科學領域中之基礎學科，而其主要的功能為利用觀察疾病在群體間的分佈，找出
可能造成疾病的危險因子（例如：病因學的探討），進而達到預防疾病在群體間的發生。本課程將透
過課堂講授與學生互動參與的方式使學生瞭解流行病學的基本知識與研究設計，課程設計主要包含兩
部份，第一部份將會回顧流行病學的基本概念以及各種主要的流行病學研究設計，並界定因果關係判
定之準則；第二部份將會討論影響流行病學研究結果內部效度偏差之來源，並且藉由文獻閱讀來說明
各種偏差對研究結果的影響。
Epidemiology is a fundamental science of public health. Its function is to identify and describe patterns of
disease occurrence, and evaluate potential determinants of disease in order to prevent disease occurrence.
This course provides an introduction to the fundamental definitions, concepts, and methods used in
epidemiology. The first half of the course will include topics of vital statistics, the parameters of measuring
disease frequency, and screening instruments. Later, the course will mainly focus on the validity and
reliability issues in epidemiology, and study design including ecologic design, case-control, cohort studies,
and randomized clinical trials. The goal of this class is to train students with the ability to conduct
epidemiological study and to correctly interpreting the study results from epidemiological investigations.
全18週

Information Science
管理科學主要專注於如何利用有限資源，諸如人力、財力和物力，使其發揮最高效能。管理科學不論於理論發展與實務應用上，均有顯著的成長。本課程旨在培育學生邏輯性、系統性、科學性思維，授予常見之管理科學方法，並透過數學模式建立，輔以提升學生問題分析及解決能力。本課程除引用一般企業案例，諸如工廠、農場、百貨、運輸、通路等案例外，額外將健康照護組織、醫療單位、居家護理機構納為分析對象，並將管理科學方法應用於其中。
The purpose of this course is to introduce the theory of Management Science. This course equips students familiar with various management science models and teaches how to apply these scientific approaches to solve problems in real world. The topics to be covered: linear programming, data envelopment analysis, transportation and assignment models, integer programming, network model, multiple-criteria decision making, nonlinear programming, queuing model and inventory model. Meanwhile, various application cases will also be discussed in the class.

這個課程是針對想要了解醫院資訊系統的一般具有計算機知識的學生。介紹醫學資訊學及醫院資訊系統相關議題，及醫學資訊領域的研究範圍。學生將學習如何捕獲，處理和應用醫療資訊。將學習資訊科學與醫學相關理論。計算機在醫學中的各種應用也將被討論，包括:政府醫療公衛資訊政策方向，遠距醫療的應用，醫療大數據的應用，疾病管控資訊系統，醫學影像資訊系統等應用。
當順利完成本課程後，將能夠：1.討論醫院資訊系統的類型及醫院資訊系統的主要優缺點，2.識別大多數醫院資訊系統中使用的電子病歷，3.討論在台灣及國際醫院中所使用不同的HIS的類型，4. 解釋醫院資訊系統的一般組織，5.描述醫療信息系統如何被醫護人員所使用，6.討論醫學資訊學的性質，影響，和未來發展。
This class is for students with a general knowledge of computers who want to know more about Hospital Information Systems. This course will Introduce to the range of research in the field of Medical Informatics. Students will learn how medical information can be captured, processed and applied. Related theories in information science and medicine will be taught. Various applications of computers in medicine will also be introduced.
When you successfully complete this lesson, you will be able to: 1. Discuss types of Hospital Information Systems the major advantages of Hospital Information Systems.  2. Recognize the electronic medical records used in most Hospital Information Systems.  3. Discuss types of HIS used for different hospitals in Taiwan. 4. Explain the general organization of Hospital Information Systems.  5. Describe how a Hospital Information System is used by health care staff.  6. Discuss the nature and impact of medical informatics.
全18週

Information Systems Planning
系統發展管理著重在系統規劃與設計之觀念的建立，藉由介紹系統開發理論的 背景知識、發展沿革，協助同學瞭解系統規劃設計的理論脈絡。課程重心以 EA 為核心，其為企業在整合業務及資訊科技面的考量後設計出的概念藍圖， 透過業務、應用、資料與技術上的規劃，有效的實現企業的目標。課程中也採 用流程建模工具，讓學生能夠以實務運作方式，建立其專業核心職能。同時為 了能結合實務，本課程也加入實務專家主導的習作與講演，以鏈結理論與產業 現況。最後，經由實務案例的演練，將理論與實作融合以提昇學習的成效。
Most complex systems today contain a great deal of software/digital components and are becoming even more complex in the future. However, software derivations are becoming the Achilles heel of complex system, while half of all large system projects are cancelled. The goals of this course are to
1.	Provide  system  engineers,  managers,  and  software  engineers  with  the  tools  and knowledge to overview system development process.
2.	Understand the global trend of ISP methods and developments.
3.	Use Enterprise Architecture to develop systems that fit organizational strategies.

Research Methods and Design in Information Management
本課程的內容訓練學生如何做一個科學性的研究，必須有一套訓練的方法，舉凡在如何尋找問題，如何解決問題，如何搜集資料，如何分析資料等都需要有一套嚴謹的方法論，最後介紹研究報告、論文之撰寫。
The purposes of this course are (1) to review research concept, include how to conduct a research, and the fundamental elements of doing a research, (2) to foster students research capability, include data collection and data analyzing, and finally to organize and report the research result, (3) encourage students share their knowledge and research experience. Also, this is a course that trains students to present an in-depth examination of an information management topic through the delivery of a professional seminar and to observe and listen to how scientific research is presented. Key skills promoted in this course are independent thinking, following international research procedures, oral and written exposition of academic research. 
After completion of this course students should be able to; take responsibility for his or her further knowledge development, using relevant scientific theories and methods from earlier researches, and independently written thesis project.

01
Fundamentals of Information Sciences
本課程介紹資訊科學的基本知識與方法，內容包括資訊科學定義、資訊科學與
醫療資訊、資訊科學與企業智慧、資訊科學方法論與建模(包括最佳化、決策分
析、模擬、迴歸分析、資料探勘、類神經網路)、資訊科學應用(包括文字與網
頁探勘、巨量資料分析)。為使學生對資訊科學研究有全面性的瞭解，除教師授
課外將輔以個案討論、範例實作，在分析模型方面，主要以Python/R/SPSS/SAS
進行資料分析與驗證，此外透過相關文獻閱讀可協助同學擬定研究方向，以落
實學習目標。
This course is designed to accomplish four objectives. The course will begin with
definition of information sciences (IS) and its relationship to medical informatics and
business intelligence. Second, the course will familiarize students with major procedures
in IS research, such as the formation of research problem, literature review, model building.
Third, the course will introduce a number of IS methodologies and applications such as
data mining, neural networks, regression analysis, text/web mining, knowledge
management, and intelligent systems. Finally, students propose a research proposal to
justify learning achievement.
全18週

Research on sports health
這門課程將研究運動對身體和心理健康的積極影響，包括心臟健康、骨骼健康、代謝健康、情緒健康和認知功能等。學生將探索運動的生理機制，以理解為什麼運動對健康有益。課程將涵蓋不同人群（如兒童、青少年、成人和老年人）的運動需求和建議，並探討如何設計個性化的運動計劃，以滿足不同年齡和健康狀況的需求。
This course will examine the positive effects of exercise on physical and mental health, including heart health, bone health, metabolic health, emotional health, and cognitive function. Students will explore the physiological mechanisms of exercise to understand why exercise is beneficial to health. The course will cover the exercise needs and recommendations for different groups of people (such as children, teenagers, adults and the elderly) and explore how to design personalized exercise programs to meet the needs of different ages and health conditions.

Calculations and Analysis of Experimental Data
本課程將深入探討運動醫學研究領域常見的重要實驗數據處理與分析方式，例如：西方墨點、酵素免疫分析法，並進一步撰寫為實驗結果，再利用統計、繪圖及海報發表方式呈現自己的研究成果。此外，本課程亦將透過參觀組織完善之實驗室及文獻閱讀方式瞭解運動醫學領域的新知與發展。
In the course of doing research, we are called on to summarize our observations, to estimate their reliability, to make comparisons, and to draw inferences. Hence, this course presents the two main topics (western blotting and enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay, stain) of experimental design and statistical analysis of experimental results in the context of the sport medicine. All concepts will
be illustrated with realistic examples, although sometimes the general theory is explained first.

Individual studies in preventive medicine and exercise health
本課程的主要目的為提高學生對預防醫學知識與運動健康的聯結，並協助其在運動保健的專業發展。課程設計將著重於肥胖對慢性退化性疾病、肌肉功能特徵、骨骼肌組織基本代謝特徵對疾病發展的影響。我們還將討論在休息和運動挑戰下和長期訓練期間的生理功能和運動性能變化的影響；最後，本課程還將探討骨骼肌與運動訓練在慢性疾病之病理生理過程與其他退化性慢性疾病 (例如：第2 型糖尿病、心血管疾病、肥胖症、慢性系統性炎症)的預防所扮演的角色。
The scope of this course is to develop and enhance students' knowledge of preventive medicine and its linkage to exercise and health. The course design will focus on the impacts of obesity on the development of chronic degenerative diseases, muscle functional characteristics, and basic metabolic features of skeletal muscle tissue. We will also discuss the changes in physiological function and motor performance under both resting and exercise challenges and/or training situations. Finally, the role of skeletal muscle tissue and/or exercise training in the disease pathophysiological process and disease prevention of several degenerative chronic diseases, such as type 2 diabetes, cardiovascular diseases, obesity, and chronic systemic inflammation is also covered in this course.

Advanced Biostatistics
本課程旨在增進學生詮釋與應用健康科學相關之進階統計方法，並協助學生
具體分辨各種統計檢定方法的適用時機，輔以相關健康議題之文獻閱讀討論
及高等統計軟體實務資料之操作，以淺顯易懂方式作圖表呈現及解釋。課程
內容除敘述統計學的複習外，將著重於推論統計學的 t 檢定、變異數分析、
迴歸及相關分析、其他實用統計分析。
The objective of this course is to provide students with advanced methods of
biostatistics in order for students to distinguish appropriate hypothesis tests of
analyzing the health related research effectively. Students are trained to discuss
and calculate real data examples of homeworks and to read journal papers.
Subjects taught in this course include (1) general concepts of biostatistics, (2)
descriptive statistics, (3) t tests, (4) analysis of variance (ANOVA) (F tests), (5)
regression analysis and correlation, (6) other practical statistical analysis.
全18週

Academic Writing for Publication
本課程旨在增進學生寫作的技巧，以達到書寫學術性文章的能力即成功的發表論文於同儕審查的期刊上。故學生在學習結束時，應能完成初步的論文草案及達到以下目標：
1.了解與熟悉學術論文寫作的方法、技巧與正確的論文寫作格式，如APA書寫方式等。
2.利用學術論文文章批判的機會，提升寫作能力。
3.了解學術期刊投稿方式、審查過程、及基本要求。
4.了解口頭報告的技巧與海報的製作方式。
This course is aimed to promote students’ logical thinking and writing skills in order to attain the ability of writing academic article. This course focuses applying theories of teaching and learning as well as applying writing skill and computer information science. The course content includes database analyses, data searching, literature review, critical thinking, APA style/format, and ethical issues of writing.

Digital Health Apps and Exercise Health Management
這門課程旨在讓學生深入了解數位健康APP的設計、開發、評估和使用，尤其是在管理運動和健康方面的應用。課程將引導學生從多個角度探討數位健康APP的關鍵議題，包括設計原則、用戶體驗、行動應用程式開發、運動數據收集和分析、健康促進和健康狀態監控等等。這些主題將有助於學生了解數位健康APP如何透過技術和設計幫助使用者改變行為、促進健康，並提升運動和健康管理的效能。在課程中，學生將有機會設計和開發自己的運動健康APP，並透過使用者反饋和數據分析等方法進行評估和優化。
This course aims to provide students with an in-depth understanding of the design, development, evaluation, and use of digital health apps, particularly in the areas of exercise and health management. The course will guide students to explore key issues related to digital health apps from multiple perspectives, including design principles, user experience, mobile app development, exercise data collection and analysis, health promotion, and health status monitoring. These topics will help students understand how digital health apps can help users change their behaviors, promote health, and improve the effectiveness of exercise and health management through technology and design. In the course, students will have the opportunity to design and develop their own exercise health apps and evaluate and optimize them through user feedback and data analysis methods.

01
Individual studies in Exercise Metabolism and Ergogenic/Health Supplements
本課程主要探討急性和長期運動訓練對代謝的影響，同時本課程也將探討運動期間脂肪、蛋白質代謝、碳水化合物代謝的交互作用的關係。第一個主題將圍繞在碳水化合物代謝、胰島素受體和葡萄糖轉運體等兩個最重要的蛋白質。其次，我們將進一步討論葡萄糖代謝的限速酶的主要途徑與調節，同時深入探討碳水化合物與脂質代謝過程與運動後的生理與生化機制。第三，本課程將討論運動過程中的蛋白質代謝。同時，運動期間的內分泌系統變化與運動代謝調節及適應反應也會在本課程討論。此外，我們也會探討運動對蛋白質合成的影響與運動營養補充時間的概念。最後，我們將整合運動訓練、常見的保健產品和運動增能劑對健康狀態、運動表現、增肌減脂的效益。
This course is designed for students interested in studying the effects of acute and chronic exercise on metabolism.  It will also integrate fat and protein metabolism with carbohydrate metabolism.  The first topics of discussion will center on the two most important proteins in carbohydrate metabolism, the insulin receptor and the glucose transporter.  Next, the regulation of the major pathways of glucose metabolism and their rate-limiting enzymes will be discussed.  Having established the biochemical mechanisms by which carbohydrate metabolism is controlled during and following exercise, lipid metabolism will be discussed and its interaction with carbohydrate metabolism.  The third section will involve the use of protein during exercise.  The effect of exercise on protein accretion will also be discussed along with the interaction of nutrient timing on this process.  Finally, the course will conclude by studying the effects of exercise training, health-oriented supplements, and exercise ergogenic aids on promoting overall health and the increases in muscle mass.
第2,4,6,8,10,12,14,16,18週

Study on health and disease behavior
本課程旨在讓學生學習21世紀的健康趨勢的演變及健康行為與疾病的相關性，內容包括健康行為的理論與改變模式，並將探討性別、年齡、媒體等與健康行為之間的關係，最後將針對健康職場與社區營造相關的策略與危險因子評估作介紹，以提升學生在健康指導上的技巧與能力。
This course includes the concepts of sociology and psychology. Also related research results will be introduced to let students understand the theories of health behavior and the relationships between changes in health behavior and prevention of diseases. In addition, this course also discusses health behavior from many points of view such as the effects of mass media, and the diversity in gender and race. Finally, some topics such as the application of health behavior change theories on work places and communities’ health promotion program will be introduced to improve students’ actual applicable ability on supervising the exercise participants in the future.

Advanced Speech Acoustics
本課程目的為建立學生對聲學的進階知識與應用。課程將介紹和言語相關的進階聲學概念，包括聲源濾波理論、聲帶振動模型、聲道面積函數、言語分析、言語合成。學生將獲得相關的實物操作能力，包括熟悉使用跨平臺、多功能的語音分析電腦軟體 PRAAT。學生將會熟悉使用聲學方法進行和言語異常、聽力異常相關的研究。
This course will provide an overview of advanced principles and applications of acoustics for speech pathology and audiology. Students will develop an understanding of advanced concepts in speech acoustics, including the acoustic theory of speech production, models of vocal fold vibration, vocal tract area functions, various approaches of speech analysis, and speech synthesis. Students will acquire a working knowledge of a versatile cross-platform computer speech analysis and synthesis software, PRAAT. Students will be able to apply acoustical methods for research studies of speech and hearing disorders.

Digital Signal Processing for Speech and Hearing Science
本課程為一學期之研究所選修課程，重點為介紹聽力語言相關之數位訊號處理技術及其應用，課程設計希望能在數位訊號處理基礎之外，加強理論及實際應用的討論。教學內容包括：數位訊號處理之相關數學基礎、數位訊號系統、語音認知(Speech Perception)及心理聲學(Psychoacoustics)基礎、聽覺系統的感應知覺原理、例如聽覺系統的時間解析(Temporal Resolution)及聽覺模型(Auditory Pattern and Model)，語音分析及合成原理，語音辨識及語者辨識。並利用電腦軟體，
This course is a one-semester course. In the Fall semester of 2013, we will focus on the fundamentals of digital signal processing applied for speech and hearing science. The course is designed not to elaborate on the digital signal processing itself but to introduce the basic concepts of signal processing and its applications for speech and hearing science. This course can be used to support other courses for the technology point of view. We will discuss some basic signal processing theory and their applications. Some reading will be assigned to the students. Computer software is also used in this course. The students will review those tools and do some analysis and processing on the signals.

Research in Adult Communicative Disorders
本課程基礎為培養學生具有評估成人語言障礙個案之能力，並提供適切介入方案與報告撰寫。課程內容包含介紹語言功能之神經解剖構造，並進一步解釋各類障礙如失語症、失智症、漸進性失語症、右腦傷、廣泛性腦創傷之病理原因與語言特徵。並透過課堂講授與實際示範標準化測驗流程，讓學生得以鑑別診斷各類語言障礙患者，以提供適切之治療方案。課程後半為進階研究，引導研究生研析成人語言障礙前瞻性文獻，並實際應用單一個案研究於實證本位介入。
The basis of this course is to cultivate students' ability to evaluate adult speech disorder cases, provide appropriate intervention plans and report writing. The course content includes an introduction to the neuroanatomical structure of language function, and further explains the pathological causes and language characteristics of various disorders such as aphasia, dementia, progressive aphasia, right brain injury, and generalized brain trauma. Through classroom lectures and practical demonstrations of standardized testing procedures, students can identify and diagnose patients with various speech disorders and provide appropriate treatment plans. The second half of the course is advanced research, which guides graduate students to analyze prospective literature on adult language disorders and actually apply single case studies in evidence-based intervention.

Differential Diagnosis in Speech-Language Pathology

能尊重溝通障礙之個案，建立全人關懷、尊重、同理心的專業倫理與服務態度，並瞭解聽語國際發展趨勢並養成社會參與及終身學習的精神
Speech and Language behavior is the most sophisticate communicating skill within human society. The ability arises from individual physical capability and acquired achievement of linguistic learning. There are various pathologic factors can compromise and distort the acquisition of this ability. The direct effect and the interaction of the these pathologic status will express different phenomenon of speech and language disorders. To learn and aware of these interaction is important for every speech and language therapist.

Research in Advanced Clinical Audiology
本課在教科書及論文導引下，討論個別測驗的理論發展基礎及在診斷上與其他測驗相較在診斷不同病火土的優勢和併用性分析。臨床技巧方面，內容涵蓋行為及生理測驗儀器操控、步驟、測驗參數的設定、反應標準、影響結果因素的分析、不良因素的排除技巧應用、測試程序的調整以提升效率，及單一測驗和跨測驗結果的綜合判讀。
This course begins with a review of the scientific foundations of each test and procedures. From that follows an examination of the diagnosis of the peripheral and central auditory system through perspectives that reflect the constant change and development of the audiology profession. For each test and procedure, the major developments and advances in diagnosis will be highlighted. This will naturally lead into discussions of recent research findings as well as reflections upon some conventional test principles or procedures.

Fluency Disorders
語暢異常是指說話時的言語流暢度出現障礙。依症狀及成因可分為三個類型包括口吃、迅吃以及神經性口吃。其中以口吃最廣為人知，主要是說話的流暢度及韻律出現障礙，目前成因仍未知；迅吃的特點是語速過快，導致說話急促且含糊不清並伴隨過多不流暢，可能和異常的語言及思考過程有關；神經性口吃指後天形成的不流暢，常導因於神經性疾病。
This course is designed to provide a comprehensive introduction of fluency disorders regarding etiology, diagnosis, and treatments. Additional skills including consulting, strategies applying, 
evidence-based practicing in treatment efficacy are applied.
全18週

Research in Pediatric Audiology
幼兒聽力學係研究幼兒聽覺系統之正常生理、聽障病理、臨床評估和聽障復健及聽障教育。特別介紹幼兒的聽障之原因 病理及臨床症狀和聽力症狀。故本課程可有如下幾個重點：（1）幼兒的聽力和聽障問題。（2）聽覺器官之解剖及生理（3）幼兒中耳炎（4）造成聽障之耳科疾病介紹，聽障之分類、分級及病因（5）介紹各種聽力評估工具、其中行為聽力檢查，含BOA、VRA、Play audiometry。（6）電生理聽力檢查，含聽性腦幹反應及耳聲傳射。（7）嬰兒及兒童之聽力篩檢之重要性及如何施行、以其是預防聽力醫學之重要一環。（8）聽障。

Research Methodology
本課程著重於介紹從事社會科學研究的基本概念、方法與邏輯，涵蓋量化與質化兩種取向。授課內容包括科學研究的基本概念、文獻檢索與探討、研究問題的產生、研究設計、資料收集、資料分析及解釋、研究寫作、研究報告評鑑、及研究的倫理議題等。學生將透過閱讀與討論相關資料、評論及撰寫研究報告等，加強對社會科學研究之瞭解並能實際運用。
The purpose of this course is to provide an introduction to the research methods used in the social and behavioral sciences, and to enhance students’ ability in doing research. Amongst the topics covered in this course are basic research concepts, research questions and hypotheses, types of research design, research methods, data analysis and interpretation, and writing research reports. In addition, by examining the related literature in early childcare and in-class discussions, it is expected that students will gain valuable insights and enhance their ability to apply critical thinking while conducting research.

Special Issues in Early Childhood Education and Care Services
課程之宗旨為培養學生以文件分析法探討有關幼兒教育及照顧、兒童福利、兒童托育服務等之政策、法規、社會事件等相關議題。本課程閱讀的文件以經濟合作暨發展組織（簡稱:經合組織：Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development，OECD）A Quality Toolbox for Early Childhood Education and Care-III，如何提升一個國家的教保生態達到優質的境界為主軸，並探討2011年我國幼托整合後在嬰幼兒教保政策、課程、教保人員的資格與薪資福利、家園社區的合作、研究與輔導及評鑑等政策的實施至今與OECD的標準比較。以及從達到教保優質的水準，我國幼托政策的可能的作為為何？
It is important to recognize the trend of development of early childhood education and care from the concepts of OECD. The aim of the course is to analyze Taiwan’s early childhood education from the views of OECD. Thus the purposes of the course are: to explore the evolution of educare services;recognize the significances and functions of educare services;investigate the types of as well as delivery and management systems of domestic child care services;analyze child care service policies; and to understand trends in international child care services
Course contents include the research papers, articles and all kinds of documents related to educare services.
Since most of the materials are written in English, it is required all the students need to familiar with the materials before they attend the class.

Seminar on  Information and online Resources

This course introduces and applies information and online resources related to two main areas: educational research and instructional material creation. In the educational research segment, we cover topics such as citation analysis, reference manager, journal impact, and the ChatGPT. The aim is to equip students with the ability to collect, organize, and critically evaluate literature, thereby enhancing the quality and efficiency of their research papers. As for the instructional material creation segment, we provide an overview of the commonly used resources and tools for digital content creation. This is to ensure that when students need to develop materials and tools for their research, they can efficiently find and assess the necessary resources and tools.

Advanced Biostatistics
本課程將奠定學生具有進階應用生物統計學的分析能力，引導學生根據研究目的，選擇正確的統計分析方法，並且在分析之後，能夠描述及解釋與分析的結果，將所得的數字結果轉換成有意義的文字解釋，並學習如何透過統計數據來解釋相關的問題與現象，同時必須學會如何閱讀和批判量化或實證的文獻或研究。課程內容包括：基本機率論、機率分佈理論、統計估計及檢定(獨立樣本及成對樣本 t-test)、變異數分(ANOVA)、相關係數、簡單迴歸分析到複迴歸分析等議題。本課程將會使用 SPSS 等專業統計軟體之操作。

(SPSS) will be introduced.

本課程旨在建構同學對於醫護課程之課程發展與教學設計之知識理論與應用能力，進而具備醫護課程設計、教案撰寫與教學示範之能力。課程內容包括課程發展、教學設計二個領域的專業，1課程發展部份：包含課程發展的原則、發展過程、模式等；2.教學設計部份：包含教學前的準備、教學中的各種方法及教學後之評估。學習活動包括文獻導讀、微型教學、教案撰寫等，已提升醫護課程設計與教學之專業能力。
This course is designed to provide students with learning experiences that will facilitate students to understand the theories of health allied E-learning and their application to school, curriculum, and teaching revolution. The units of this course include the learning theories (conditioning 
theories, social cognitive theory, cognitive information processing theory, cognitive learning processes, constructivist theory, neuroscience of learning), application of E-learning, teaching and 
learning in E-learning, and how to use LMS and LCMS. The students will be enhanced with concepts about the theories of health allied E-learning, and analyze their application in the theories of 
health allied E-learning.
全18週

Curricular & Teaching Evaluation in Allied Health Education
本課程旨在增進學生對課程評鑑與教學評量的理解與應用，內容包括課程評鑑的概念、模式與方法、教學評量的概念、紙筆測驗命題技巧、試題分析、實作評量、檔案評量及臨床能力評量等。教學/學習方法包括講述、討論、文獻評析、口頭與書面報告等，學生須配合醫護教育實習，獨力完成一份課程評鑑與一份教學評量報告。
This course aims to enhance students' understanding and application of curricular and instructional evaluation in allied health education. The course contents include the concepts of curricular evaluation and educational assessment, test construction and item analyses, performance evaluation, portfolio evaluation and clinical competence assessment. Multiple teaching methods are composed of lectures, discussions, articles reading, oral and written reports. Students will applied the learned knowledge and skills in writing a curricular evaluation and report. Students will plan, conduct, and report an evaluation study of a curricular program and an instructional evaluation.

01
Reproductive Physiology and Pathology
本課程旨在探討人類生殖生理學的原理與機轉，及婦女孕育過程中的醫療處置及其機轉和最新趨勢，課程內容包括生殖系統解剖構造與功能、生殖內分泌調節、月經週期、受精與著床、胎盤發育與功能、胎兒發育與生長、懷孕期的免疫與生理調適、基因與遺傳疾病以及分娩與泌乳，及妊娠與內外科合併症、不正常分娩、羊水栓塞、分娩與麻醉。藉由課室教學與討論使學生熟悉生殖生理的原理與機轉，並且能應用於臨床實務以及研究當中。
The aims of this course are to present the principles and mechanisms of reproductive physiology and pathology. The contents include the structures and functions of reproductive system, regulation of reproductive endocrine, menstrual cycles, fertilization and implantation, the development and function of the placenta, the development and growth of embryo, immunological aspects and physiological adaptation of pregnancy, genetic disorders, parturition and lactation, preconceptional counseling and prenatal care, prenatal diagnosis and antepartum assessment, intrapartum assessment & management of abnormal labor, newborn assessment and resuscitation, assisting initiation of breastfeeding, the puerperium and possible complication, pregnancy hypertension, gestational diabetes mellitus, fetal growth disorder, multifetal gestation, obstetric hemorrhage (antepartum and postpartum), postterm pregnancy and induction of labor, and medical and surgical disease complicating pregnancy.
  Through selected topics and discussion, students will understand advanced reproductive physiology and pathology, then will be able to apply the knowledge in clinical practice and the research.
全18週

Advanced Biostatistics
本課程以教授研究所學生具有進階應用生物統計學的分析能力。強調生物統計學之應用與醫學及護理臨床研究結合，以奠定學生具有資料收集、資料分析及統計報表解讀之能力，同時有能力評值學術期刊所發表的文章。課程內容包括：基本機率論、機率分佈理論、統計估計及檢定(獨立樣本及成對樣本t-test)、變異數分析(ANOVA)、相關係數、簡單迴歸分析到複迴歸分析等議題。本課程將會使用SPSS等專業統計軟體之操作。
The objective of this course is to provide graduate students with the advanced knowledge and understanding of the methods of statistical analysis applicable to medical and nursing research.  Also, this course is directed to equip graduate students with advanced capability of applying statistical analysis.  The course is 'math-lite but operation-heavy' emphasizing concepts and application of statistical thinking and application. Probability theory, parametric statistics, correlation, regression, ANOVA, correlation analysis and regression analysis along with computer package practice (SPSS) will be introduced.

01
Childbirth Education
本課程旨在協助學生成為專精之生產教育指導者，課程重點包括（1）具備懷孕、生產、產後婦女及其家庭變化及需求的正確理念及生產教育者的角色功能，（2）統整及應用課程設計、團體動力、諮商、賦權、創意/批判性思考等理論於生產教育實務，（3）討論/批判相關研究文獻並應用研究成果。教學方法將以互助及經驗分享式之學習為主，學生將以教學方案展現專精之生產教育能力
This course is designed to prepare students for training as a childbirth educator. The content includes (1) professional role of the childbirth educator; (2) promoting a safe and healthy pregnancy and birth; (3) assisting women and their families to make informed decisions for childbearing; (4) providing information and support that encourages attachment between babies and their families; (5) assisting women and their families to discover and to use strategies to facilitate normal, natural, and healthy pregnancy, birth, breastfeeding, and early parenting. (6) design, teach, and evaluate a course in childbirth preparation that increases a woman’s confidence and ability to give birth.
全18週

practical verification of meridians and acupoints. It is hoped that students can 
have an understanding of the empirical theory and research, and apply it to 
clinical health care, so as to enhance the students' health care ability in 
practical nursing. The course content includes introducing the current status of 
empirical research on meridians and acupoints and teaching the commonly used 
nursing interventions in clinical practice so that students can enhance the 
empirical ability of the precision nursing of integrated traditional Chinese and 
western medicine.

01
Diagnosis of Chinese Medicine
本課程旨在讓學生熟悉中醫診斷的基本概念與臨床常用診斷方法。主要學習經驗包括望、聞、問、切四診之傳統及現代化的研究方法，八剛辨證、六經辨證、衛氣營血辨證之診斷標準的熟悉。使學生能習得中醫的診斷、增進觀察能力，並且結合現代護理診斷的觀察與記錄，瞭解病患疾病的特質，以為選擇中西醫最佳治療方法。
This course attempts to familiarize students with the fundamental concepts and clinical diagnostic methods of Traditional Chinese Medicine. Inspection, Ausculation, Interrogation, Pulse Taking, and Palpation will assist us to collect comprehend many numerous signs and symptoms of the patients. In addition, eight principal syndromes for diagnosis, five zang-organs, six fu-organs, and theory of the Six Channels, Wei-Qi-Ying and Xue Systems included. These will promote the diagnostic abilities of the students. We combine Chinese-Western nursing diagnostic methods to obtain more information from the patient. This will be an essential basis from which to choose the best practices from both Modern and Traditional Chinese treatments.

本課程以教授研究所學生具有進階應用生物統計學的分析能力。強調生物統計學之應用與醫學及護理臨床研究結合，以奠定學生具有資料收集、資料分析及統計報表解讀之能力，同時有能力評值學術期刊所發表的文章。課程內容包括：基本機率論、機率分佈理論、統計估計及檢定(獨立樣本及成對樣本t-test)、變異數分析(ANOVA)、相關係數、簡單迴歸分析到複迴歸分析等議題。本課程將會使用SPSS等專業統計軟體之操作。

Also, this course is directed to equip graduate students with advanced capability of applying statistical analysis.  The course is 'math-lite but operation-heavy' emphasizing concepts and application of statistical thinking and application. Probability theory, parametric statistics, correlation, regression, ANOVA, correlation analysis and regression analysis along with computer package practice (SPSS) will be introduced.

The main learning objective of this course is to enable students to understand the basic theory and practice of acupuncture and traumatology of traditional Chinese medicine. The course content includes the introduction of acupuncture and traumatology, the principles of meridian, acupuncture points as well as moxibustion, the syndrome differentiation and nursing care to common acupuncture-related diseases, the principle of traumatology, the diagnosis and therapy of traumatology, and musculoskecullar adjustment manipulations for neck, shoulder, and back pain. This course aims to cultivate students' capabilities of the foundational theoretical and practical skills of acupuncture and traumatology, which can be applied to health and disease care.

This course combine several nursing theories and tendency with Traditional Chinese Medicine with
Western nursing and their applications to the current self health care. Students can know the nursing
of scientific research and its relationships to theories in Traditional Chinese Medicine with Western
nursing

to theories in Traditional Chinese Medicine with Western nursing.

Advanced Pathophysiology
本課程主要自疾病發生之機轉探討疾病症狀之原理與診斷、處置之理論基礎，以擴展學生作進階臨床評估與處理患者問題之憑藉。課程之進行將針對常見疾病之病理、生理學加以解說，使學生能藉此了解疾病之致病機轉、疾病進行之過程與顯現之表徵、評估診斷之原理依據、與治療原則，以達基礎與臨床合一之目標。

Clinical Pharmacology & Therapeutics
本課程之設計係以護理研究所碩士班學生為授課對象。課程內容著重目前有關心血管藥理、癌症治療等方面之進展為主，並探討相關藥物之藥理作用機轉與目前臨床應用有關之藥物資訊等，故使用之教材係取自較新之期刊論文，目的是讓學生對於最近之醫藥相關科學之發現與進展能獲得最新資訊。
This elective course is designed for nursing  students at the graduate level. It emphasizes the pharmacological mechanisms and clinical application of  the agents commonly prescribed in disease teratment. Topics in this course include drugs acting on cardiovascular systems, anti-neoplastic drugs, anti-psychotic drugs, analgesics, hormones, anti-inflammatory drugs, anti-diabetic agents and anti-microbial agents. All teaching materials come form major medical journals and computer-based information resources of drugs. The aim of this course is to provide our students the most advanced knowledge about the drugs they will encounter in clinical practice.

Data Management and Statistical Analysis in Medical Research
本科目於教學設計上，乃著眼於資料庫管理與統合各種量性資料分析方法之實務操作，目標在於提昇學生管理與分析統計相關資料之能力。課程中將運用SPSS統計套裝軟體來學習以下統計資料管理與分析策略：1)建立資料庫檔案並進行資料庫檔案之增刪、編輯與修改；2)著手分析健康照護相關之研究資料、繪製資料圖表;3)運用描述性與推論性統計策略;4)撰寫研究資料之分析結果。整體而言，選修本課程之學生，將透過課程講授、實際練習操作統計套裝軟體及實例研討等方法，落實學習統計資料之管理與分析。
The objective of this course is to provide students with practical applications of bio-statistical methods by running the SPSS statistical software. Two sample data (depression data and factor analysis data) in the health related agendas will demonstrate and analyze effectively. Major topics and headings will include (1) overview of SPSS statistical software, (2) data arrangement (3) descriptive statistics, (4) analysis of variance, (5) simple regression analysis and correlation, (6) multiple regression analysis and correlation, (7) category data analysis, (8) logistic regression analysis, and (9) repeated measurement based on the applied consideration of medical science. The advance ability toward the management of quantity data will be the core of teaching plan and interactive procedure. The aims of this course are to promote and reinforce students actually understand the whole-spectrum of basic statistics and its practical directions.
全18週

Health Care of Adult II - Practicum
本課程承續成人健康照護 I 旨在(1)持續增進學生照護成人族群的護理專業能力；(2)持續培育學生發展成人進階護理專業人員的角色與功能；以及（3）增進學生成人族群健康護理之實證實務能力。.學生須統整所學的應用於臨床護理照護實務情境，並於醫療照護團隊中展現溝通協調的能力。
This course is a continuum of the Clinical Practicum for Adult Health Nursing I. The purposes of the course are to advance professional competence of students in adult health care and cultivate students to perform professional roles of an advanced nurse practitioner or specialist in Adult clinical setting. Within the practicum, students will practice actual roles of and assume responsibilities of an advanced nurse practitioner or specialist.

Community Health Care Nursing Ⅱ
本課程旨在養成學生在社區中以社區整體和不同群體為對象的健康照護專業能力。透過社區評區，確認社區診斷，計劃、執行健康處置並評值其成效。學生並能在過程中學習和發展與社區中不同專業合作的夥伴關係。
The course is designed to develop the health care competence on aggregate level, through the process of community assessment, community diagnosis, health planning, implementation, and outcome evaluation. At the end of the course, students will be able to develop the partnerships among different professionals in the community.

Health Care for Women II
此課程要旨在於增進學生發展婦女健康照護之臨床護理專家角色的養成能力，包含：個案的
照護與支持、護理人員的在職教育或個案健康教育、個案管理、諮商及研究；學生必須運用
相關的理論於臨床實務，並展現臨床護理專家的功能。本課程包括：增進學生照顧婦女的臨
床專業能力， 發展臨床護理專家角色的養成能力，期使學生能運用相關的理論於臨床實務，
並展現臨床護理專家的功能，增進學生在婦女健康護理之實證及實務能力。
The purposes of the course include: (1) students continuing to build on their clinical 
expertise in selected women care arena, (2) students developing CNS roles, specifically, in client care 
and support, staff development, leadership and research. Students are expected to develop, 
implement and evaluate a project related to role emphasis of the CNS.  （3）Students continuing to 
increase their professional competency in women health nursing evidence-based practice.
全18週

Health Care for Women II    (Clinical Practicum)
此課程要旨在於協助學生繼續發展某一婦女健康專業之臨床專長。學生能
應用相關的理論及進階護理角色，展現某一婦女健康的臨床護理專家，繼
續發展婦女健康之進階護理角色，例如：個案照護、管理、教育、研究及
諮詢等，契約學習是臨床教學的主要策略。
This course is designed to assist students  continuing to build on their 
clinical expertise in selected women care area.  Students apply the selected 
theories to clinical situations on an operational basis is emphasized. By 
selecting an area of interest, students are required to demonstrate the role 
functions of a CNS in appropriate clinical settings. Students  develop CNS 
roles, specifically, in client care and support, staff development, management 
and research. students continuing to increase their professional competence 
in women health evidence-based practice.

01
Independent Study
本課程以個別指導之形式，依據碩士生之護理專長背景及未來專業發展方向，引導學生探索相關核心概念、理論，結合其臨床專業技能，應用批判性思考及實證護理的概念，訂定研究方向及主題，擬定研究設計、完成研究計畫之書寫。
This course is delivered in an individualized format, tailored to the nursing specialization and future professional development of the master's student. It guides students in exploring relevant core concepts and theories, integrating their clinical expertise, applying critical thinking and evidence-based nursing concepts, determining research directions and topics, and developing research designs, culminating in the completion of a research proposal.
全18週

Nursing Information Managemetn II
本課程的目的在提升學生暸解資訊科技在健康照護機構的應用及推展過程。學生可暸解資訊科技發展的策略計畫、機構組織改變及健康照護上的應用狀況及其相關議題。課程內容包括資訊科技推動策略的應用、組織的改變過程、資訊科技的整合、資訊科技推動成效及相關議題，旁及於健康資訊隱私及安全議題之探討。
The purpose of this course is to assist students in identifying the major concepts information management within healthcare organizations. Students will be able to understand the application of information technology on strategic planning in consultation, organizational change process, care transformation and evolution, the development of and the evaluation of care outcome. Issues of nursing ingormation management and data privacy and patient safety will be explored as well.

Advanced Applied Biostatistics
本課程以教授研究所學生具有進階應用生物統計學的分析能力。強調生物統計學之應用與醫學及護理臨床研究結合，以奠定學生具有資料收集、資料分析及統計報表解讀之能力，同時有能力評值學術期刊所發表的文章。課程內容包括：基本機率論、機率分佈理論、統計估計及檢定(獨立樣本及成對樣本t-test)、變異數分析(ANOVA)、相關係數、簡單迴歸分析到複迴歸分析等議題。本課程將會使用SPSS等專業統計軟體之操作。
Biostatistics plays an essential role in all stages of a quantitative health care research from design through to analysis and interpretation. This course covers the essential principles and methods required for a master degree. Emphasis is on study design, appropriate analysis, software application (SPSS) and interpretation of results. The underlying concepts of statistical analysis are covered. Sessions include lectures and practical work, both computer-based and using small workshops for discussion.
The course aims to teach health care researchers the essential elements of research methodology and statistics. The focus is mainly on interpretation and understanding appropriate methodology.

Nursing Theory
本課程旨在培養學生應用護理理論於實務、研究、教育和行政中之能力。主要學習經驗包括探討護理理論發展史、理論家背景、理論的重要概念及其闡述的現象、理論的應用。在引導下，學生深入研討至少一個護理理論，透過相關文獻的分析、歸納和演譯，練習將整合後的心得和經驗提出報告與同學分享、討論以達成本課程的目標。
This course examines several nursing concepts and their applications to the current health care environment including practice, education, administration, and research. Students begin to recognize the nature of science and its relationships to theories in nursing. Through discussion, lecture, and specially designed projects, students will learn the philosophy and background of a theorist and her/his theory and develop skills in analyzing health care issue, particularly those with relevance to nursing.

the course. Through lectures, discussions, and reports, students will expand their knowledge and 
competency for managing common mental health issues and community health by integrating 
evidenced-based nursing and their clinical experiences.

This course provides students to have the basic concepts of health promotion and management for health care. The major focus of the course encompasses: Introduction(Prevalence, evaluation of body composition) Etiology and health impact of obesity and underweight Obesity related disease: Metabolic syndrome, health management related problem in menopausal women, Health problems in Abnormal weight during childhood, Clinical approach of weight management, Nutritional strategies of weight management , Exercise strategies of management , Comparison of variant diet of health promotion and management: evidence based approach Visiting clinics 1(including exercise practice and diet preparation practice) ,Obesity treatment: medical, surgical and herbal preparation , Behavior approach of health promotion and management, E-health management. Students present their understanding of the health issues about health promotion and management through the participation and discussion in the class.

本課程旨在培育成人專科護理師學生具備急性醫療特定疾病病人之進階知識與技能，並加強其對對專科護理師角色、功能與執業議題之瞭解。課程強調運用批判性思維與實證醫學和護理，以建立適當之健康問題診斷、處置和評價照護結果之學習。透過講述、學生課堂導讀、案例分析、小組討論、角色扮演、影片情境分析與數位平台討論等多元教學策略，訓練學生批判性思考、溝通與自學能力，並培養學生具備成人專科護理師入門所需之知識與技能，使其能以專科護理師的角色提供急性醫療特定疾病病人適切之進階護理照護。
This course provides the student with in-depth knowledge of advanced nursing management of complicated and acutely ill adults. Emphasis is on the utilization of critical thinking and evidence-based practice to formulate diagnoses and management and evaluation plans of care for physiologically unstable and complicated adult patients who have multiple complex health problems, and are at high risk for developing complications.  The focus is on the management of specific system problems of acute care. This course provides students with advanced knowledge necessary to deliver advanced nursing care in acute care settings.

Adult Practice Nursing II - Practicum
本課程旨在培育成人專科護理師學生，具備急性醫療嚴重病人照護之進階知識與技能，並加強其對對專科護理師執業議題之瞭解。實習課程強調運用批判性思維與實證醫學和護理，以建立適當之健康問題診斷、處置和評價照護結果於所照護之個案。透過實習契約書之訂定、實習指導教師與實習教學教師的共同輔導、實習日誌、個案報告、互動記錄、臨床照護指引、教案與實習心得的完成，以確保學生的實習經驗，至實習結束每位學生將至少照護十位內外科急性醫療嚴重病人，以培養學生具備成人專科護理師所需之知識與技能，使其能以專科護理師的角色提供病情嚴重之急性醫療病人適切之進階護理照護。
The course is a continuum of the clinical practicum for adult health nursing I. The purposes of the course are (1) to train students’ competencies in assessing, diagnosing, examining, and managing common medical and surgical health problems, (2) to facilitate students’ consultation ability for emotional responses of acute ill patients, (3) to cultivate students’ case management ability, (4) to increase students’ communication and collaboration to achieve excellent care, and (5) to be familiar with ethical and legal issues affecting NP practice in Taiwan.. Within the practicum, student will demonstrate actual roles and responsibilities of an acute care nurse practitioner.

01
Advanced Psychiatric Mental Health Nursing (II)
本課程旨在昇化學生（1）人文關懷涵養；(2)擔任進階精神衛生護理師持續性照護之相關知能，課長包括探討進階精神衛生護理師的角色與功能、法律定位和業務範圍、個案的管理與轉介、護理標準的訂定、維持與評值、協調連繫與照會等；(3) 展現學生批判性及自我導向之學習歷程。學生藉著連結社區照護相關資源、執行家庭護理評估、帶領治療性團體、執行危機處理和溝通協商的演練以達成進階精神衛生護理師之培育目標。
This course is designed to help students to obtain advanced knowledge regarding (1) Life Concerns (2) roles and functions (3) ethics and legal issues of advanced psychiatric mental health nursing, (4) to apply group psychotherapy, family therapy and crisis interventions in the psychiatric mental health nursing (5) to perform critical thinking, ethics and decision making、collaboration with team work and long life learning.
全18週

This course is designed to help students to integrate related theories and clinical practice of advanced psychiatric mental health nursing, including (1) Life Concerns (2) roles and functions (3) ethics and legal issues of advanced psychiatric mental health nursing, (4) to apply group psychotherapy, family therapy and crisis interventions in the psychiatric mental health nursing (5) to perform critical thinking, ethics and decision making、collaboration with team members and long life learning.

Individual Studies in Health Technology
This course introduces the field of health technology and the key concepts and definitions in this emerging field. The key topics include digital health and various types of health technologies to include mobile applications, wearable technologies, health information systems, telehealth, telemedicine, machine learning, artificial intelligence and big data. These technologies are assessed in terms of the key opportunities and challenges to their use and the evidence of their effectiveness in the field of digital health in relation to public health and healthcare globally. The use and application of digital health for exercise prescription forms a case report demonstrating the use of immersive interactive training device of digital health technologies to address key aspects of the principle to design an optimal exercise program.

01
Applied Exercise Physiology Research
This course is designed to extend the fundamental knowledge of anatomy and physiology to an advanced level in applied exercise physiology. We combine both basic applied and exercise physiology theories and experiments to help students learn how to evaluate physiological changes in response to physical activity and exercise. In addition, students can understand how to predict exercise performance and benefits of exercise training. In this course, experimental methods for evaluating aerobic/anaerobic exercise performance, body composition, and carbohydrate metabolism during exercise are covered, and trends in the development of exercise physiology are discussed as well. In the completion of this course, students can integrate the knowledge from both fundamental theories and experimental aspects.

Designing and Developing Health Promotion Plans
This course is aimed to train students’ ability in developing and testing health promotion plans. This course focuses applying theories and strategies for promoting health in different populations as well as applying research methods in developing and evaluating health promotion plans. The course content includes history and development of health promotion, models and approaches to health promotion, application and skill to health promotion, assessing different ages’ and groups’ needs, process for developing health promotion plans, planning health promotion interventions, implementing health promotion and evaluation in health promotion. This course also discusses health promotion influencing factors from many points of view such as the effects of mass media and marketing, and the diversities in gender, race, as well as culture.

本課程旨在探討運用動物及自然素材於人類健康照護、教育輔導、及行為矯治等層面上之各種議題及現況，將生命教育內涵融入醫護及教育實務中，來協助學生以尊重生命的理念，落實在人類身、心、靈、社會與環境的多面向照護上。課程內容包括動物福利理論與世界趨勢，動物對人類身心靈社會環境健康之角色與功能、寵物治療的相關理論、施行模式及國內外研究趨勢、動物及自然素材在健康照護、教育輔導與行為矯治等層面之應用等。本課程希望藉由課堂講授、討論、參觀見習、文獻研讀、實作、及影片研討等方式，帶領學生認識動物在人類健康照護與教育輔導領域的

01
Seminar of Tourism, Food and Health
隨著國民健康意識抬頭，遊客旅遊時不再只是享受美食，如何吃得健康也是旅遊者關注的議題。由於旅遊時的飲食營養會影響遊客的健康與旅遊品質，因此本課程結合旅遊、餐飲、營養與飲食文化等內容，藉以討論旅遊之餐飲與健康。主要課程內容說明如下: (一)旅遊與營養:旅遊中六大類食物與營養素、營養標示、每日飲食指南與食物代換表在健康飲食上之應用; (二)旅遊餐飲衛生與安全:旅遊飲食衛生之注意事項與食物中毒之預防; (三)慢性疾病遊客之飲食:糖尿病、高血壓、高血脂、痛風、腎臟病等患者旅遊時之營養照顧; (四)飲食文化與營養:討論各國不同的飲食文化與餐食營養。
As people are becoming more health conscious, tourists are no longer just seeking for gourmet food while traveling, but also caring about healthy eating. Diet while travelling affects both health and travel quality. Therefore, this course combines information concerning travel, nutrition, health, and culture to explore the experience of enjoying food & beverages while traveling abroad. The main topics covered in this course are the followings: (1) Travel & Nutrition: The six essential categories of food and their nutritional content, introduction to nutritional labeling, and daily dietary guidelines; (2) Food & Beverage Sanitation and Safety While Travelling: Precautions for food hygiene and prevention of food poisoning while travelling; (3) Diet for Tourists with Chronic Diseases: Nutritional care for Tourists travelling with diabetes, hypertension, high cholesterol, gout, kidney or other diseases; (4) Food Culture and Nutrition: A discussion of different food cultures and the nutritional content of their diets.
全18週

Seminar in Recreation Planning and Management
本課程旨在傳授與遊憩與管理相關的概念、理論、方法和技術，包括遊憩資源調查、分析、規劃、節目企劃、管理與解說等，學生不僅可習得專業知識，更可獲得相關的實務經驗。課程內容主要強調以下幾個重點：（1）常見的規劃模式、因子分析、以及現在盛行的遊憩規劃理念；（2）旅遊計畫管理：旅遊節目企劃、管理、與評鑑的原則與方法；（3）遊客中心和遊憩服務設施的設計與管理；（4）遊客管理工具與技術；（5）環境解說與教育的哲學、原則與方法。
This course presents advanced principles of recreation planning and management, including concepts, theories, skills and techniques in survey, analysis, planning, programming, management and interpretation of recreation resources through lectures and field experiences. The contents of the course emphasize: (1) the planning models, factor analysis, and modern design concepts in recreation resources planning; (2) recreation program management: principles and methods for program planning, management, and evaluation; (3) visitor center and facility design and management; (4) tools and techniques for visitor management; and (5) philosophies, principles, and methods of environmental interpretation and education.
全18週

This course is tried to aim at overall ideology of health related to health, esp. focusing on coping with urgent/emergent health conditions during traveling, such as any related issue around persons, events, materials, and environments/situations…etc.. Going through this course, with mandatory lecture, in-class discussion, and some necessary practice, the student will be supposed to possess global concept of travel & health, and van take time to deal with those health and related crises, and furthermore in peculiar occasion, validating the theoretical content of crisis management.

Teach students how to present a well-done dissertation with systematically research approaches and related references. Students will be able to apply research knowledge and formulate a research proposal through individual and group discussion and assignments. Students will be able to identify a research problem, organize relevant literature, and design a feasible method for their study.

Multivariate Statistical Analysis
本課程旨在銜接應用統計學，使進一步瞭解多變量解析之理論、內涵與技巧。課程內容聚焦在結構方程模式(SEM)之使用。課程進度從多變量之一般介紹開始，進而推進至SEM相關原理及方法，並以PRELIS, CFA及 Structural Equation Model為主要介紹內容，以為爾後進行論文中相關計量方法之使用預作準備。
This sequential course is designed to link to the advanced applied statistics with the techniques of multivariate statistical analysis. The course contents focus on Structural Equation Modeling with the application of LISREL software. It proceeds from the introduction of basic concept and methodology to LISREL language, then to PRELIS, CFA, and Structural equation models. At the end, all students are facilitated with the ability of programming SEM problems.

Research in Travel Health Behavior
本課程旨在介紹及解析旅遊與休閒情境中所發生與健康有關行為之心理機轉及其重要架構，例如：健康信念模式、理性行動理論、計畫行為理論、跨理論模式等各種理論模型。並透過校外參訪見習，觀察並記錄旅遊情境或旅客實際參與行為，將理論與實務之結合，以激發研究生思考及活用與理論相關之研究架構。此外也導讀該領域之最新研究論文及探討健康行為實例，藉由分析與討論來激發研究生理論與實務之結合。
The purpose of this course is to introduce and analyze the main theory and model of health behavior applied in travel situations. Several significant theories and models (e.g., Health Belief Model, Theory of Reasoned Action, Theory of Planned Behavior, Transtheoretical Model) will be discussed. By reading and in-class discussion about the newly journal and periodicals of travel health and behaviors, it is expected that graduate students not only comprehend theories and models but also know how to apply them.

This course is designed to be interdisciplinary by integrating medical, nursing, psychological, social, and other aspects of long-term care perspectives. The course is aimed to delineate overall figure of defining, presenting, assessment, intervention, providing, and related issues of professional tasks and management, practices and delivery of Long-Term Care (support & protection, LTC). Along with the contemporary LTC, it encompassed the attainment of LTC team, skill & technology, assessment toolkit, care plan, care activity designing, quality control, and operating & managing, for the rooting and growing of care management, seed planting faculty & material, professional empowering and industry forming, rather, for related policy promotion campaign regarding LTC demand & supply, education & nurturing, advising & counseling, reviewing, and other necessary contextual factors.
For the application of this care approaching & intervention, to empower or fulfill this new field in the country, we expect the course will examine LTC related living & life, activity, participation and health (aging, morbidity, de-conditioning), contextual factors and corresponding approaching and intervention on various care clients／recipients, sites, role. Through understanding, handling, delivering, and creating care services potentially can make good use of available resources linking, to interact, and to integrate with all related professional disciplines involved. Through lectures, oral presentation and in-class discussion, the learners with the professional background or basis would be supposed to organize the knowledge, skill and value(principle) of care, ultimately to provide pertinent relationship, prediction, agreement, plan, choice of tactics….etc., and then closing anyway.

01
Overiew of Long-Term Care
隨著醫療科技的進步與人的壽命不斷延長，長期照護（long-term care）已經是當前先進國家須正視的課題，臺灣也將在2025年時邁入超高齡社會的時代，言下之意臺灣總人口數中將有超過20%的65歲以上人口；面對人口結構的轉變，您準備好了嗎? 本課程將藉由人口學角度入門，旨在引導學習者認識長期照護的基本概念、探討人口高齡化下帶給社會的改變，並透過閱讀長期照護相關文獻進行長照相關議題的探討，培養學習者對長期照護有2 基本的專業知能、技巧，以及初步評估與因應能力。同時培養學習者對長期照顧議題的關心與服務的熱情，能了解長照的新興趨勢，並促使對長期照護專業的興趣與參與動機，藉此培育更多專才投入長照領域。
With the ageing of population increasing dramatically, maintaining health in old age becomes increasingly important. Successful policies in this area can increase the potential labor force and the supply of non-market services to others. They can also delay the need for long term care for the elderly by preventive strategies. This course discusses all the issues related to long-term care from micro- and macro- perspectives.
全18週

Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery in Databases
Course is designed for scientific master students. Course content provides students the use of advanced data mining tools through real-world practical examples. Course covers the basic data science concept, major data mining algorithms and data model deployment in application. The major topics include classification, clustering, association, derivation detection, visualization and summarization techniques. Importantly, we propose to bridge the gap between theory and practice, and apply data mining solutions in real world applications. The course will be built with several real cases – medical application ex. breast cancer classification, directing customers to subscription through App behavior analysis, minimizing chum rate through analysis of financial habits, credit card fraud detection, insurance contract analysis, etc. The course will be practically oriented, emphasizing the knowledge discovery process, economic considerations and implementation issues. Course is designed for scientific master students. Course content provides students the use of advanced data mining tools through real-world practical examples. Course covers the basic data science concept, major data mining algorithms and data model deployment in application. The major topics include classification, clustering, association, derivation detection, visualization and summarization techniques. Importantly, we propose to bridge the gap between theory and practice, and apply data mining solutions in real world applications. The course will be built with several real cases – medical application ex. breast cancer classification, directing customers to subscription through App behavior analysis, minimizing chum rate through analysis of financial habits, credit card fraud detection, insurance contract analysis, etc. The course will be practically oriented, emphasizing the knowledge discovery process, economic considerations and implementation issues. Real world assignments, involving realistic and simulated data, will provide the students with hands-on experience in using data mining in practice.

Seminar in Big Data Analysis
本課程介紹巨量資料的基本知識與方法，內容包括巨量資料分析的趨勢與挑 戰、巨量資料的定義與來源、半結構與非結構化資料處理，以及如何運用人工智慧(artificial intelligence)與機器學習(machine learning)建構深度學習(deep learning)模型。為使學生對巨量資料分析的理論發展與實務應用有全面性瞭解，將以影像辨識與物件偵測、文本分析為主安排業師授課輔以個案、範例介紹及實作。每位同學於期末須提出研究專案方向，以落實學習目標。由於專案實作需有程式設計基礎，建議可使用的語言有Java, Python, R 與 Visualization 等工具。本課程主要目標要能呈現期末專案成果與實務應用之價值(business value)。
This course will begin with trend and challenges of big data analysis, and is followed by the machine learning algorithms, technical architecture, and programming (Python/R for text mining and SNA analysis); they are domain knowledge and techniques for the analysis. Students must propose a term project to justify learning achievement.

Seminar in Health Technology
本課程介紹了健康照護與資訊科技應用的知識、基礎設施、功能和工具。在實務個案中探討規劃和管理知識在健康照護工作中的應用，重點傳遞著健康科技研究概念框架以及更深層次的影響。課程將以照護技術為發展前提，藉由案例分享，讓學生了解目前健康科技議題之下的產業變革，並瞭解相關技術應用優勢，包括資訊系統、醫療科技以及照護專業等。期望同學藉由個案的閱讀、討論、分析、傾聽與反思的過程，培養健康科技應用決策所需的邏輯思維與知識，提昇同學對於未來研究與就業展的專業能力。
This course introduces the knowledge, infrastructure, functions, and tools of health care and information technology applications. Practical cases explore the application of planning and management knowledge to health care work, conveying the conceptual framework of health technology research and its deeper implications. The course content will begin with care technology, and through case sharing, students will learn about the changes in the industry under current health technology issues and understand the advantages of related technology applications, including information systems, medical technology, and the care profession. Through case reading, discussion, analysis, and reflection, students will be able to link theory and practice to enhance their understanding of health technology development. This course is designed to enhance students' understanding of the development of health technology. Through thorough exposure to health technology cases, course participants will become familiar with the logic, theories, and uses presented in the cases and understand the strengths, challenges, and limitations of the current industry development in the cases.
全18週

01
Gerontology
根據美國老年學會（Gerontological Society of America）的定義，老人學是對於老化過程（aging processes）及處於生命歷程當中的個人（individuals across the life course）之研究領域。它探索當個人年老時所發生的生理、心理及社會面向的變化；它研究因人口老化所引起的整體社會變遷；它應用這些知識於政策與實務領域之中。老人學本質上即是一個跨學科的多元領域，除了因為對老化的共同興趣所聚集的不同專業人員的協力合作外，期望能透過研究、教育、實踐與應用跨領域知識，以增進年老人口的生活品質與福祉。本課程透過介紹老人學的主要理論、概念及議題，引導學生思考並理解老年人口的異質性與多元性。
This gateway course highlights lots of things or issues used to examine many problems and disciplines related to the aging & the elderly. The learners would be guided to get familiar with the demography, biology, psychology, sociology and public policy for the aging and elderly, and then can gain access other related or extended fields of it. Old people have been getting decayed all the way in all aspects with impacts and deprivation in mixed and complex manifestation, encompassing perception, sensation, health, behavior, disability and dementia biomedically; rather, cognition (intellectuals, memory, attention, learning, and creativity…etc), personality trait, stress & coping, psychiatric disorders, even death & mourning in mental aspect;; socially, communication & interaction network, friend making, marital status, retiring, leisure, living arrangement, socioeconomic status, and care arrangement; potentially, extending over spiritual aspect. Thru’ multidisciplinary lectures and discussions may be helpful to handle the potential differences, such as gender, ethnicity, histogram, interaction and living experiences accumulation, all of them will facilitate the approaching of the multi-aspect and complex presentation of aging and elderly.
全18週

Statistical Methods for Evidence-based Medicine
次級（或稱二手）資料（secondary data）經常是健康照護相關研究之材料，在重視實證醫學的今日，許多研究均利用各種次級資料進行統計分析，以評估健康照護品質及病人之預後。在台灣，除了許多醫療機構本身的資料庫（例如醫院之醫檢報告，健檢報告）外，舉凡癌症登記、生命統計、死亡登記等全國性資料庫一直是實證醫學研究中經常利用的重要研究素材。本課程將以實例介紹台灣地區各種可用於實證醫學及健康照護研究之次級資料，並將以「全民健康保險學術研究資料庫」為對象進行實地之統計分析及示範，同學也將被要求分析此健保資料庫樣本

Seminar on Big Data Analysis
本課程介紹巨量資料的基本知識與方法，內容包括巨量資料分析的趨勢與挑戰、如何運用機器學習(machine learning)演算法於巨量資料處理、巨量資料的架構與技術(Hadoop, MapReduce/MR, Ecosystem)、巨量資料處理的程式設計(以Python / R開發應用)。為使學生對巨量資料分析有全面性的瞭解，除教師授課外將輔以個案討論、範例實作，此外透過相關文獻閱讀可協助同學擬定期末專案方向，以落實學習目標。由於 Hadoop 是採用 Java 語言撰寫，對於許多不熟悉 Java 語言的同學來說有相當大的入門障礙，因此本課程會先調查同學程度，再進行考量。可能用到的工具會有Java, Python, R與Visualization等工具。主要能呈現期末專案成果與business value，與培養 story telling 的能力。
This course will begin with trend and challenges of big data analysis, and is followed by the machine learning algorithms, technical architecture (Hadoop, MapReduce/MR, Ecosystem), and programming (Crawler development with Python, text mining and SNA analysis with R); they are domain knowledge and techniques for the analysis. Students must propose a term project to justify learning achievement.

學術論文寫作主要協助學生培養縝密的思考及良好的寫作組織能力，才能在論文中呈現清晰的邏輯，以及順暢的文章條理。教學重點，包括學術寫作的基本原理及結構、句子段落寫作、文章連貫性，以及學術寫作最常運用的寫作方法，同時搭配適當的討論與寫作練習。希望能透過課程設計，幫助學生練習寫作策略與技巧，培養學生進行碩士論文寫作之基礎。
Academic writing and publication course is mainly designed to help students to develop their logical thinking and writing ability, which are critical to present clear logical thinking
process in the academic papers and thesis. The primary teaching focus includes the basic principles of academic writing and structure, sentence paragraph writing, article coherence,
and most commonly used writing methods in academic writing. Moreover, the appropriate discussion and writing practice will also be performed in this course. Through the curriculum design, we will help students to practice writing strategies and skills and guide students to familiarize the fundamental requirement of thesis writing.
全18週

01
Research in Exercise Metabolism and Ergogenic/Health Supplements
本課程主要探討急性和長期運動訓練對代謝的影響，同時本課程也將探討運動期間脂肪、蛋白質代謝、碳水化合物代謝的交互作用的關係。第一個主題將圍繞在碳水化合物代謝、胰島素受體和葡萄糖轉運體等兩個最重要的蛋白質。其次，我們將進一步討論葡萄糖代謝的限速酶的主要途徑與調節，同時深入探討碳水化合物與脂質代謝過程與運動後的生理與生化機制。第三，本課程將討論運動過程中的蛋白質代謝。同時，運動期間的內分泌系統變化與運動代謝調節及適應反應也會在本課程討論。此外，我們也會探討運動對蛋白質合成的影響與運動營養補充時間的概念。最後，我們將整合運動訓練、常見的保健產品和運動增能劑對健康狀態、運動表現、增肌減脂的效益。
This course is designed for students interested in studying the effects of acute and chronic exercise
on metabolism. It will also integrate fat and protein metabolism with carbohydrate metabolism.
The first topics of discussion will center on the two most important proteins in carbohydrate
metabolism, the insulin receptor and the glucose transporter. Next, the regulation of the major
pathways of glucose metabolism and their rate-limiting enzymes will be discussed. Having
established the biochemical mechanisms by which carbohydrate metabolism is controlled during
and following exercise, lipid metabolism will be discussed and its interaction with carbohydrate
metabolism. The third section will involve the use of protein during exercise. The effect of
exercise on protein accretion will also be discussed along with the interaction of nutrient timing on
this process. Finally, the course will conclude by studying the effects of exercise training,
health-oriented supplements, and exercise ergogenic aids on promoting overall health and the
increases in muscle mass.
全18週

Individual studies in Biotechnology of Exercise and Health Science
本課程以生命科學領域中常用的分析技術與系統生物學方法(體學研究)來探討探討運動生理與健康促進可能的調控機轉與生理適應機制，並透過跨領域學科與新穎科技平台的介紹與探討，並簡介動物實驗在運動保健與藥物開發上扮演的意義，並以實務操作過程了解原理與技術，對如何應用到他們的研究題目，甚至在運動生理、運動訓練、運動適應與健康促進的實務執行面具有重要幫助。
In this course, we will introduce the latest technologies and system biology (omics study), widely applied to life science field, and how to apply and combine the exercise science field. Therefore, the researchers/students could comprehensively understand the possible mechanisms to physiological regulations and adaptions. Practically, we also demonstrate the sample processes and analytic procedures to graduate students for specific technological tools. The student could applied the novel technology to understand the mechanism of physiological adaption, training effects, and health promotion with exercise effects. Eventually, we hope this course could bring the experience of interdisciplinary learning to graduate students attending to this course.
全18週
