Independent Study
本課程旨在引導學生深入研究特定主題或問題，鼓勵他們運用跨學科知識，發展自己的研究問題和方法。學生將學習如何制定研究計劃、收集和分析數據，並獲得撰寫研究報告的技能。此外，學生還將研究學術文獻，以理解該主題的現有知識並尋找研究的空白。
This course is designed to guide students through an in-depth study of a specific topic or problem, encouraging them to apply interdisciplinary knowledge and develop their own research questions and methods. Students will learn how to develop a research plan, collect and analyze data, and gain skills in writing research reports. In addition, students will research academic literature to understand existing knowledge on the topic and identify research gaps.

Study on aging and physical activity
本課程旨在教導學生老化進行過程、現象及相關理論、身體活動的測量、身體活動與與老化關係等相關知識，提升學生對中老年人進行運動處方及身體活動設計時所需要的能力，並藉由相關文獻選讀及發表讓學生了解有關身體活動的相關研究與理論。

Theory and application of health behavior intervention
以學生學過的社會學、心理學為基礎，配合相關的運動與醫療保健經驗，探討健康行為介入的理論及其於運動保健的應用。內容包括個人的、人際的、家庭的、社區機構的、社會的健康行為理論模式與實際應用；嬰幼兒期、兒童期、青少年期、成年期與老年期的健康行為；並包括健康行為改變理論與策略。另外再從行銷、大眾媒體、性別與種族文化等不同的角度來探討健康。
This course is based on the concepts of sociology, psychology and student’s working experience of exercise and health-related profession. It is aimed to explore theory and intervention of health behavior in exercise field. It comprises individual, interpersonal, family, community, institutional and social models of health behavior and practical applications; also health behaviors in infancy, childhood, adolescence, adulthood, and old age; and the theories and strategies of health behavior change. Besides, this course discusses health behavior from many points of view such as the effects of mass media and marketing, and the diversities in gender, race, as well as culture.

Academic Writing for Publication
本課程旨在增進學生寫作的技巧，以達到書寫學術性文章的能力即成功的發表論文於同儕審查的期刊上。故學生在學習結束時，應能完成初步的論文草案及達到以下目標：
1.了解與熟悉學術論文寫作的方法、技巧與正確的論文寫作格式，如APA書寫方式等。
2.利用學術論文文章批判的機會，提升寫作能力。
3.了解學術期刊投稿方式、審查過程、及基本要求。
4.了解口頭報告的技巧與海報的製作方式。
This course is aimed to promote students’ logical thinking and writing skills in order to attain the ability of writing academic article. This course focuses applying theories of teaching and learning as well as applying writing skill and computer information science. The course content includes database analyses, data searching, literature review, critical thinking, APA style/format, and ethical issues of writing.

Study on physiology of exercise
本課程旨在讓學生了解人體在進行各種不同強度及時間的運動時，生理器官所產生的適應反應與機制，而課程中所包含的專業文獻選讀與發表訓練亦能提升學生在運動指導時的專業能力。另外，本課程亦含括體適能及運動表現的概念及訓練方法等相關內容。
This course is to provide students with the general knowledge of Physiology of Exercise.  Students can learn how the human organs and systems run to maintain the stability and functions of human body when people practice different kinds of exercise intensity and time. In addition, via studying professional research and presentation, students can also improve their ability to integrally supervise the exercise participants in the future. The concepts and training approaches of the health-related physical fitness and movement performance will also be covered in the course.

Academic Writing for Publication
本課程旨在增進學生寫作的技巧，以達到書寫學術性文章的能力即成功的發表論文於同儕審查的期刊上。故學生在學習結束時，應能完成初步的論文草案及達到以下目標：
1.了解與熟悉學術論文寫作的方法、技巧與正確的論文寫作格式，如APA書寫方式等。
2.利用學術論文文章批判的機會，提升寫作能力。
3.了解學術期刊投稿方式、審查過程、及基本要求。
4.了解口頭報告的技巧與海報的製作方式。
This course is aimed to promote students’ logical thinking and writing skills in order to attain the ability of writing academic article. This course focuses applying theories of teaching and learning as well as applying writing skill and computer information science. The course content includes database analyses, data searching, literature review, critical thinking, APA style/format, and ethical issues of writing.

Advanced Voice Disorders Research
本課程目的為建立學生嗓音異常相關的進階批判性研究思維及研究能力。範圍包括嗓音科學的研究、嗓音自我評估的研究、聲學測量、電聲門圖的研究、發聲閾壓、發聲氣流閾值的研究、高速數位攝影機與相關的分析、切除的喉的實驗、喉部再生醫學的研究、嗓音治療療效的研究。
This course will facilitate students to develop a critical mind of inquiry necessary for evaluating the research literature in human voice production and voice disorders. Students will become familiar with and be able to critique published research studies in voice-related areas, including self-assessment of voice disorders, acoustic and electroglottographic measures of phonation, phonation threshold pressure and phonation threshold flow, high-speed digital imaging of vocal fold vibration and videokymography, excised larynx experiments, laryngeal regenerative medicine, and efficacy studies of voice therapy approaches.

Research in Aural Rehabilitation
本科目探討影響語音感知的信號、內在個體聽覺、病理因素和外在溝通環境的視覺因素及上述因素交互影響的效果，內容佐以臨床的個案分析和適用的聽能/讀話/溝通策略處理方式的教學及溝通障礙臨床諮商。設計聽能訓練復健計畫的先備知識，聽覺損傷者及照護者和家人在生活、工作、家庭、社交、心理等多方面的需求，也一併討論。
This course examines factors affecting speech perception of the hearing impaired (such as signal transmission, auditory sensitivity of the hearing-impaired individual, the underlying audiological pathology, available visual cues and the communication environment) and how these factors combined shape the communicative challenges facing the individual. Case studies are incorporated to illustrate how speechreading skills with communication strategies can help the patients and their frequent communication partners in coping their social, psychological difficulties as well as challenges in their job and career.

Mobile App Programming and Application

Research Methods and Design in Nursing
本科目旨在介紹社會科學和行為科學的研究方法，以提升學生解決問題的科學態度和研究能力。主要內容包括研究問題擬定、量性研究設計、抽樣、倫理考量、質性方法、資料分析和解釋、研究計畫撰寫等。教學方法包括研究文獻導讀、批判與回饋、小組討論、研究計畫簡報等，以培養學生的學術倫理概念、批判思考、溝通能力及國際視野。
This course aims to introduce research methods in social science and behavioral science to 
enhance students' scientific attitudes and research capabilities in problem solving. The main content 
includes formulating research questions, quantitative research design, sampling, ethical 
considerations, qualitative methods, data analysis and interpretation, and writing research proposals. 
Teaching methods encompass literature reading, critique and feedback, group discussions, research 
proposal presentations, aiming to cultivate students' understanding of academic ethics, critical 
thinking, communication skills, and global perspectives

本課程主要探究學習科技(Learning technologies)在臨床教學實務中所扮演的角色，其中將帶領學生認識視訊網路教學的發展，培養學生建構與設計學習科技應用服務，並訓練學生撰寫基礎程式語言的思維與能力。本課程逐週介紹不同的學習科技工具與程式語言觀念，學生們將透過實作方式培養程式撰寫與學習科技的應用能力。本課程期望從學習科技應用、基礎程式撰寫與應用、教學設計規劃、教學實戰演練等活動培養學生善用媒體工具規劃教學活動的技能，辨析各類學習科技於教學情境的適用性
This course aims to familiarize students with theoretical foundations as well as instructional practices of video lecture and online instructions. Students are expected to understand how to apply learning theories to the design and implementation of video lectures to broaden the scope of learning in the digital world. In the meantime, how video lectures are integrated into medical/nursing education will be discussed.
全18週

01
Data management and statistical analysis in medical research
本課程透過課程講授、實際練習操作統計套裝軟體及實例研討等方法，著眼於資料管理與統合各種量性資料分析方法之實務操作，目標在於提昇學生管理與分析統計相關資料之能力。課程中將運用 SPSS 統計套裝軟體來學習以下統計資料管理與分析策略，如建立資料檔案並進行資料檔案之增刪、編輯與修改；著手分析健康照護相關之研究資料、繪製資料圖表；運用描述性與推論性統計策略；撰寫研究資料之分析結果。
The objective of this course is to provide students with practical applications of bio-statistical methods by running the SPSS statistical software. Two sample data (depression data and factor analysis data) in the health related agendas will demonstrate and analyze effectively. Major topics and headings will include (1) overview of SPSS statistical software, (2) data arrangement (3) descriptive statistics, (4) analysis of variance, (5) simple regression analysis and correlation, (6) multiple regression analysis and correlation, (7) category data analysis,
(8) logistic regression analysis, and (9) repeated measurement based on the applied consideration of medical science. The advance ability toward the management of quantity data will be the core of teaching plan and interactive procedure. The aims of this course are to promote and reinforce students actually understand the whole-spectrum of basic statistics and its practical directions.
全18週

Academic Writing for Publication
學術論文寫作主要協助學生培養縝密的思考及良好的寫作組織能力。教學重點，包括學術寫作的基本原理及結構、 句子段落寫作、文章連貫性，以及學術寫作最常運用的寫作方法，同時搭配適當的討論與寫作練習，架構研究問題、形塑研究假說、收集並歸納研究議題相關之背景知識與現存之科學證據，進而對於現有之科學證據進行系統性之評析與回顧，評斷先前所提出之臨床問題之合宜性，並以科學原則修正。希望能透過課程設計，幫助學生練習寫作策略與技巧，引導學生基於上述之科學原則以符合學術研究倫理之方式適切的撰寫學術文章
This course aimed at guiding the class attendants to formulate practical problems into study propositions and hypothesis with the emphasis on scientific and logical principles. The primary teaching focus includes the basic principles of academic writing and structure,sentence paragraph writing, article coherence, and most commonly used writing methods in academic writing. Through the curriculum design, we will help students to practice writing strategies and skills and guide students to familiarize the fundamental requirement of thesis writing.
全18週

Innovative Practice in Allied Health Education and Digital Learning

Traditional Chinese medicine: Practice and Research
本課程旨在培育學生具中醫藥基本知識之基礎知能及現代中醫(Modern TCM)進階科學化精神，課程設計以陰陽五行之觀念為基礎，並介紹八綱辨証, 經絡輸穴, 中醫疾病如何辨證及各種中醫手法等主題。以激發學生對中醫藥的興趣.
This program aims to nurture the professional ability of combining the TCM and Western Medical. Students have to use their knowledge of TCM and nursing, for example like physiological pathology、etiology、clinical diagnostics、physical assessment and management . Through the subject of Traditional Chinese medicine: Practice and Research, this program uses organized and systematic way to integration of theoretical and clinical practice, and implement the plans in the program. In this way, the professional ability of students could be strengthened, and fulfill the purpose of the program.

Nutrition in Chinese Medicine
藥膳學在中醫基礎理論指導下, 將中草藥與食物相配伍, 運用傳統之飲食烹調技術和現代加工方法製成味、色、形具佳的、更有保健和治療作用之食品, 其內容廣泛, 迄今已有三千年之歷史. 所謂藥食同源更是集中而深刻的體現了藥膳之重要性. 而其藥膳成分對於人體自律神經及自由基及體內自泌素之影響更是本科目之重點研究.本課程共分: 藥膳概論、穀物湯膳與研究、蔬菜湯膳與研究、果品湯膳與研究、畜肉湯膳  與研究、海鮮湯膳與研究、藥草湯膳與研究和美容養生湯膳與研究等

In this way, the professional ability of students could be strengthened, and fulfill the purpose of the program.

01
Research Methodology
本課程旨在培養學生對專業問題質疑，以科學方法來設計合宜解決之道。主要學習經驗包括專業現況的質疑、邏輯推理的練習、文獻的查證和組織、研究的設計、研究計畫的撰述等活動。學習者將透過討論與主題相關的作業之落實，來增進對研究主題可行性的評估能力。
The aim of this course is to enhance the inquisitiveness of students towards the nursing problem and enhance their competencies in problem solving by adopting scientific approaches. The research process will be the focus of the course content. Students will read and criticize research articles intensively throughout the semester. At the end of the course, students will demonstrate research competencies by presenting a research proposal and critiquing proposals of others in class.
Objective
1.	develop an inquisitive attitude towards nursing issues and problems.
2.	review, integrate and synthesize literatures to formulate a conceptual framework appropriate for the  research proposal to be presented in class.
3.	critique selected research articles/papers in terms of problem statement, literature reviews, research methods and conclusions and implications.
4.	develop appropriate research design for the proposed research.
5.	present and critique the research proposal.
全18週

Database Design and Application
本課程旨在培養學生對資料庫設計及其應用有基本概念，瞭解資料庫的基本概念、資料庫分析與設計的理論基礎及其使用軟體工具，藉由實際撰寫資料庫設計程式，能瞭解資料庫系統具有資料管理功能，同時也介紹資料庫管理系統於護理實務領域的應用狀況，讓學生體認資料庫設計概念於健康及護理實務領域的重要性。
This course will foster the student to have the basic concept of the database design and application. This course will assist students to understand the basic concepts of database systems, the theoretical basis of the analysis and design database and the application of software tools. Through the practice writing the program language of design database, students would understand database systems have data management functions. Also introduces database management system application status in the field of nursing practice. Through this course, students can recognize the concept of database management systems on the importance of the healthcare and nursing practice field.
全18週

Adult Practice Nursing I
本課程旨在培育成人專科護理師學生具備照護急性住院病人常見健康需求之進階知識與技能，並加強其對對專科護理師角色、功能與執業議題之瞭解。課程強調運用批判性思維與實證醫學和護理，以建立適當之健康問題診斷、處置和評價照護結果之學習。透過講述、學生課堂導讀、案例分析、小組討論、角色扮演、影片情境分析與數位平台討論等多元教學策略，訓練學生批判性思維考、溝通與自學能力，並培養學生具備成人專科護理師入門所需之知識與技能，使其能以專科護理師的角色提供急性住院病人適切之進階護理照護。
This course provides the student with in-depth knowledge of common clinical situations in acute care setting. The role and function of the acute care nurse practitioner will be integrated throughout the course. Emphasis is on the utilization of critical thinking and evidence-based practice to formulate diagnoses and management and evaluation plans of care for physiologically unstable adult patients who have health problems, and are at high risk for developing complications. The focus is on the management of specific system problems of acute care. This course provides students with fundamental knowledge necessary to deliver advanced nursing care in acute care settings.
全18週

Adult Practice Nursing I - Practicum
本實習課程旨在培育成人專科護理師學生，照護急性住院病人常見健康需求，展現入門之專科護理師角色與功能，應用進階之護理知識與技能於提供病情單純之成人病患照護，並對專科護理師常見之執業議題有初步瞭解。實習強調運用批判性思維與實證醫學和護理，以建立適當之健康問題診斷、處置和評價照護結果於所照護之個案。透過實習契約書之訂定、實習指導教師與實習教學教師的共同輔導、實習日誌、個案報告、互動記錄、鑑別診斷形成與問題解決過程報告、與實習心得的完成，以確保學生的實習經驗，至實習結束每位學生將至少照護十位內外科常見之急性住院病人，以培養學生具備成人專科護理師入門所需之知識與技能，使其能以專科護理師的角色提供病情單純之急性住院病人適切之進階護理照護。
This course provides the student to apply knowledge of advanced nursing management in acutely ill adults. Emphasis is on the utilization of critical thinking and evidence-based practice to formulate diagnoses and management and evaluation plans of care for physiologically unstable adult patients who have health problems, and are at high risk for developing complications. The focus is on the management of specific system problems of acute care. This course provides students to apply fundamental knowledge necessary to deliver advanced nursing care in acute care settings.
全18週

Health Care of Elderly I
此課程旨在透過對老人老化及疾病相關之病理、生理、心理、情緒及靈性需求之理論、研究與議題研討，增進學生老人照護的臨床專業能力。學生需統整及應用老人疾病照護、經濟、主要照顧者、社會、組織、資源整合、臨終照護等理論研究於臨床實務中，發揮個案照護之功能，並需針對特定議題完成方案以展現其老人臨床照護專家的角色及功能。
This course in designed to assist students acquiring clinical expertise in the nursing care of healthy aging population with specified health problems. Theories, research, and issues relevant to normal developmental transitions and changes in aging will be discussed. Emphasis is placed on physiological, psychological, family-social-cultural-environmental, spiritual, and functional aspects related to nursing interventions with the healthy aging population. Students are expected to develop a preliminary conceptual model to explain a clinical phenomenon involving healthy aging and its implication in nursing.
全18週

Health Care of Elderly I - Practicum ( 144hours )
此實習旨在透過對老化及疾病相關之生理、病理、心理社會及靈性需求之理論、並配合應用口述歷史進行老人生命回顧之研討，學生需同時統整及應用老人疾病照護、主要照顧者、社會組織、資源整合、臨終照護等理論於臨床實務中，發揮個案照護之功能。學生並透過自我導向之學習，於醫療照護機構及社區情境中完成獨立提供老人連續性健康照護，以期展現老人照護專業角色功能及實務能力。
This course in designed to assist students acquiring clinical expertise in the nursing care of healthy aging population with specified health problems. In this course, students are required to select a problem or an issue discussed in the seminar, and complete the nursing process through integration and application of the theories for selected clients in appropriate clinical settings. Students are expected to develop a preliminary conceptual model to explain a clinical phenomena involving aging and its implications in nursing. Problem solving and critical thinking skills of students will be enhanced by the teaching strategy in this course.

Health Care of Children (I)
本課程在協助學生發展兒童健康照護之進階護理能力。內容強調兒童於成長環境中危險及保護因子的評估，及身體評估、諮詢、教育、溝通、照護決策等相關進階能力之培養。由發展、家庭、環境等相關理論的角度，引導同儕關懷並深入探討出生至青春期住院兒童的相關健康議題；學生藉由自我主導學習統整學理及實證研究運用於住院兒童照顧實務上。
This course focuses on two populations, the families with children at risk and the families with hospitalized children. Through the research findings of different approaches, such as risk and resilience, development, family, and ecology, students will expand their views to assess the child’s environment and the related health issues. Advanced professional competence in the care of the pediatric population will be highly emphasized in this course.

Advanced Psychiatric Mental Health Nursing (I)
本課程旨在培育學生具有（1）人文關懷涵養；（2）進階精神衛生護理師專業知能，包括照顧、溝通、專業及自我成長、管理等能力。主要學習經驗包括進階精神疾病個案護理經驗、個人和團體心理治療、治療性環境經營管理等；（3）引導學生進行批判性及自我導向之終生學習歷程，藉著整合自己之精神衛生護理之學理和臨床經驗，增強照護個案治療的知能，以及與醫療團隊的溝通協調。
The purposes of the course are (1) to develop person-center nursing care; (2) to have advanced psychiatric-mental health knowledge and skills, including those of nursing, communication, specialty, self-growth, management, etc. (The major learning experiences include those of advanced psychiatric mental health nursing, individual and group psychotherapy and management of treatment environment, etc.)；(3) to guide students to critique and self-directed learning in order to associate with psychiatric-mental health knowledge and clinical experiences, to develop knowledge and skills of nursing, to practice crisis intervention and to promote communication and coordination of medical teams.

Adult Practice Nursing II - Practicum
本課程旨在培育成人專科護理師學生，具備病情嚴重病人急性醫療照護之進階知識與技能，並加強其對對專科護理師執業議題之瞭解。實習課程強調運用批判性思維與實證醫學和護理，以建立適當之健康問題診斷、處置和評價照護結果於所照護之個案。透過實習契約書之訂定、實習指導教師與實習教學教師的共同輔導、個案報告、臨床照護指引與實習心得的完成，以確保學生的實習經驗，至實習結束每位學生將至少照護十位內外科病情嚴重病人，以培養學生具備成人專科護理師所需之知識與技能，使其能以專科護理師的角色提供病情嚴重之急性醫療病人適切之進階護理照護。
The course is a continuum of the clinical practicum for adult health nursing I. The purposes of the course are (1) to train students’ competencies in assessing, diagnosing, examining, and managing common medical and surgical health problems, (2) to facilitate students’ consultation ability for emotional responses of acute ill patients, (3) to cultivate students’ case management ability, (4) to increase students’ communication and collaboration to achieve excellent care, and (5) to be familiar with ethical and legal issues affecting NP practice in Taiwan.. Within the practicum, student will demonstrate actual roles and responsibilities of an acute care nurse practitioner.

01
Qualitative Research
本課程旨在提供學生認識質性研究及其在護理上的運用。課程內容包括質性研究概念的介紹、研究設計、資料的收集與詮釋、以及報告的撰寫。本課程藉由課堂講授，輔以論文研討等方式帶領學生認識質性研究方法，並探討其在應用上的重要議題，以輔助學生在閱讀及使用質性研究方法的能力
This course focuses on the basic of qualitative research and its applications in the
nursing field. The contents of this course include qualitative perspective on research,
qualitative research design, qualitative data collection and analysis, and qualitative
research reporting, etc. The major issues for utilizing qualitative research methods will
be also discussed in this course. Lecture and discussion will be used as the teaching
strategies. Students will be able to read and apply qualitative research critically.
全18週

01
Evidence-based Health-care and Application
本課程主要協助學生瞭解護理之實證研究與實證實務，期使學生能在實證之理論與研究上有所認識，而應用於臨床有關健康照護，以增進學生健康照護之護理實證實務能力。課程內容包含實證相關之理論與研究以及實務層面，例如臨床決策之評量、質量性研究之評量、實證研究問題之發展、發展搜尋策略、研究品質之評量、發展實證護理研究計畫等。
This course provides students to have the concepts of evidence-based nursing for research and
practice in healthcare. The major focus of the course encompasses the understanding of the issues
about evidence-based research and practical application through the participation, presentation, and
discussion in the class.
全18週

01
Independent Study
本課程以個別指導之形式，依據碩士生之護理專長背景及未來專業發展方向，引導學生探索相關核心概念、理論，結合其臨床專業技能，應用批判性思考及實證護理的概念，訂定研究方向及主題，擬定研究設計、完成研究計畫之書寫。
This course is delivered in an individualized format, tailored to the nursing specialization and future professional development of the master's student. It guides students in exploring relevant core concepts and theories, integrating their clinical expertise, applying critical thinking and evidence-based nursing concepts, determining research directions and topics, and developing research designs, culminating in the completion of a research proposal.
全18週

Thesis

This course is structured as individualized instruction, aiming to assist the master's student in utilizing clinical practice as a foundation. It focuses on the application of nursing theory and research skills, the execution of research protocol, data analysis, and the completion of research outcome reports and the master's thesis.

本課程旨在增進學生照護成人健康之護理專業能力。成人病患常見的健康問題之臨床實務面，學生須統整並運用所學之內外科護理學、生理病理學、病因學、臨床診斷學、身體評估以及管理學等相關理論。藉由整合學理和臨床實務，學生能增強成人個案照護與治療等相關的學理，且能展現醫療團隊的溝通協調，以達成本課程的目標。

Students will be able to apply knowledge and theories of medical-surgical nursing, patho-physiology, etiology, clinical diagnosis, physical assessment, and management. Application of theories into clinical practice and coordination of health care team effectively to manage adults’ health problems will accomplish the course objectives.

The purpose of this course is to assist students in identifying the major theories and models of information management within nursing practice. Students will be able to understand the application of nursing informatics on clinical care, education, research and management. The nursing information specialist roles in the system selection and evaluation, education strategies, technology use in care evaluation, and the introduction of e-nursing is also included. Additionally, the future trends of the development of nursing informatics scope and standards of practice are identified as well.

Practicum of Nursing Information Management I
此課程旨在使學生能應用護理資訊管理學於臨床科技使用之情境分析。學生需瞭解資訊科技如何運用於臨床病人照護，並分析相關臨床照護資訊科技使用之議題。同時，學生需應用相關護理資訊管理理論與概念架構於一特定護理科技應用系統分析與設計，並探討護理資訊護如何滿足臨床照護者、護理管理者、護理教育者及其未來發展；旁及於參與系統使用過程的教育訓練與評值、及瞭解系統設計如何受到健康照護潮流衝擊的影響。
This course provides students an opportunity to analyze the current situations of nursing information management. Learning activities include applying a related theory or concept analysis in design and development of a project to investigate a nursing information technology application on meeting identified needs and trends in nursing students, clinicians, administrators, nursing faculty and patients and families. Students will participate in planning, education and evaluation of the implementation of a nursing information system, and to identify the impact of selected trends on the design of nursing information systems. Students will also address current and future clinical issues on selected nursing information technologies on health care.
全18週

This course is delivered in an individualized format, tailored to the nursing specialization and future professional development of the master's student. It guides students in exploring relevant core concepts and theories, integrating their clinical expertise, applying critical thinking and evidence-based nursing concepts, determining research directions and topics, and developing research designs, culminating in the completion of a research proposal.

Innovative Applications of Artificial Intelligence
本課程旨在增進同學對人工智慧前瞻且創新議題的瞭解，啟發同學們
對如何運用AI人工智慧，以提升產業競爭優勢之策略思維。課程進行將以理論與實務之AI策
略為主，透過播放相關短片與專題講座、專題演討等方式讓同學們理解AI科技對健康照護產
業、生活型態等所造成的影響與改變。接著，以主題討論方式藉由探討AI科技應用於健康照
護產業中的實際案例，幫助學生更了解目前產業與國際的趨勢。
This course aims to enhance students' understanding of forward
looking and innovative issues of artificial intelligence, and inspire students' strategic 
thinking on how to use AI artificial intelligence to enhance industrial competitiveness. 
The course will focus on theoretical and practical AI strategies. By playing relevant 
short videos, special lectures, special lectures, etc., students will understand the 
impact and changes of AI technology on the health care industry and lifestyle. Then, by 
discussing the actual cases of AI technology applied in the health care industry in the 
form of a themed discussion, it will help students better understand the current industry 
and international trends.
全18週

Research Methodology
本課程內容第一階段為科學研究:包含科學精神、研究主題的選
擇、文獻的蒐集彙整、研究構念的概念化與操作化、測量的基本概念與方法、假說的檢定、
抽樣的基本概念、 資料分析、研究結果的呈現與詮釋等。第二階段為撰寫學術研究論文:學
術論文各章節的寫作要 點,包含題目與摘要、前言、文獻探討、APA 論文寫作格式、概念性
架構與假說檢定、測量、 結果、結論與討論。
This course is designed to accomplish four objectives. The course 
will begin with issues in scientific thinking, model building, and ethical implications. 
Secondly, it will familiarize students with major procedures in research design, such as 
the 
formation of research questions, literature review, conceptualization and 
operationalization of research questions, questionnaire design, and sampling procedures). 
Thirdly, the course will review methods in data collection and analysis with special 
emphasis on the evaluation of data quality such as reliability and validity. Finally, 
this course will familiarize students with major guidelines for writing research papers.
全18週

Advanced Applied Statistics
本課程旨在幫助學生瞭解統計學相關應用，包括資料整理、機率
論、抽樣分配、估計與信心區間等主 題；學期後半段，將著重在提出研究假設之能力培養，
同時訓練學生運用各種方法進行假設檢 定，包括卡方檢定、t-test、變異數分析、簡單迴歸
分析，並透過課程講授、交互討論、課後作業及學習考試方式，探討統計學相關之觀念、原
則、模式與方法。
This course is designed to help students understand the application 
of statistics. Including data collection, probability theory, sampling allocation, 
estimation and confidence intervals; in the second half of the semester, the focus will 
be on cultivating the ability to propose research hypotheses. This course also teaches 
students to use various methods to test hypotheses, including chi-square test, t- test, 
variation analysis, simple regression analysis Students will explore concepts, principles, 
models and methods related to statistics through course lectures, discussions, homework 
and study exams.

Individual Studies in Science of Sports Training
Sports training is an increasingly important area of sports science, and this course provides accessible and up-to-date coverage of this key topic. Modern coaches need to be applied scientists who keep abreast of research and are able to apply a multidisciplinary understanding to their practice. The course therefore examines training/coaching in terms of biomechanics, physiology and psychology, as well as perennial issues such as athlete motivation, nutrition, design of training programmes, talent identification, monitoring and ethics.

Alternative and Rehabilitation Sport Medicine Research
This course is designed to discuss the differences between alternative complementary medicine and current western medicine.  For example, the traditional Chinese medicine and herb medicine have already been gradually accepted, and we will guide students to read and search current scientific literatures that support the therapeutic benefits of alternative complementary medicine. Also, students will learn the benefit of exercise training, sport injury, mechanical stress and injury during sport or physical activity, and prevention of sport injury through reading the related scientific journals.  The scientific supports and current development for alternative and rehabilitation sport medicine will be covered in this course.

Horticultural Therapy
近年來輔助治療越來越重要，富士康的跳樓事件、大學生的自殺事件、弱勢者的生心理重建等，甚或醫護人員、心理諮商師、社工師、以及各類型的照護人員例如老人失智及罕見疾病的家屬等，他們的工作環境充滿壓力。因此園藝治療及接觸庭園的活動對於人的生心理健康有不可忽視的力量。園藝治療簡單來說，就是利用接近植物以及庭園活動來得到不良行為的改善、生理及心理上的健康。園藝治療是強調園藝栽培的過程中所得到的精神及生理上的利益。園藝治療課程的編排最有效的方法包括能快速見到成效的種子繁殖或蔬菜種植; 具有簡單重複步驟可循的無性繁殖; 戶外活動如澆水、施肥、修剪、拔雜草等; 以及和植物有關的設計課程，例如組合盆栽、組合擺盆、插花、壓花卡片、乾燥花、花束、花袋、景觀攝影、植物繪畫、植栽設計等。總而言之就是針對要治療的對象先做需求及工作能力分析後，訂定目標，然後藉由園藝活動來達成目標。例如一個手部不方便中風的人，不要在冰冷的室內物理機器做復健，取而到戶外來種植她想吃的菜，然後透過戶外播種、澆水、除雜草、鬆土一樣可以得到效果，且吃到自己種的蔬菜獲得滿足及自信感，最重要的是不要讓病患覺得自己在治病，因此只要自家有可以照光的陽台便可以做居家照護。本所學生如果訓練基本的園藝治療能力更可以對自己及對患者都有加分作用。
Human relate to plants. That is the basis for therapeutic landscape design (being) and horticultural therapy (doing). Horticultural therapy is designed for children, for those with physical disabilities, for patients with Down’s syndrome, Alzheimer’s disease , for the elderly, for those with genetically illnesses and their families, and for prison inmates. They are large or small, fully accessible or only for viewing, and for day and night use. Their value lies in the positive associations people have with plants.
This course tells you the theory of horticultural therapy, healing landscape and the techniques of how to set up a therapeutic garden and horticultural operations.
    This is the unique course opened that mentioned about the horticultural therpay in Taiwan’s universities and colleges, and extremely fun.

01
Issues and Ethics in the Counseling Professions
諮商助人專業有其專業的倫理守則，以規範及維繫諮商服務的專業品質，並保護案主的福祉。成為諮商助人工作者除了必須恰如其分地運用專業知能協助案主外，同時在面對案主各種複雜多元的處境與問題，所產生之不同的倫理情境或議題時，諮商心理師須要有足夠的能力予以辨識、判斷和因應處理。本課程旨在培養學生了解諮商專業的倫理守則與相關法規，並訓練學生對於諮商場境中常有的倫理實務議題，進行思辯與討論，以奠定日後從事諮商專業工作時的專業倫理素養與因應能力。
Counseling profession has its professional ethics in order to protect clients’ welfare and to provide better services, as well as to sustain the quality of counseling profession. To become a professional counselor, students must learn professional knowledge and skills very well, and at the same time, they have to learn how to deal with various difficult ethical dilemmas or issues in different counseling situations. Therefore, this course aims at teaching students:
1.	to understand counseling professional ethical codes and related laws.
2.	to explore and to discuss different ethical issues in many counseling situations.   
3.	to develop professional ability to deal with counseling ethical issues.
全18週

Counseling Practicum(1)
學生修習悲傷輔導專題、諮商與心理治療理論、諮商技術與實務專題研究、團體諮商專題研究等課程後，應透過實際進入輔導機構實習過程，以觀摩學習和實地操練的參與方式，學習對輔導對象提供個別諮商、團體諮商工作方式，增進對諮商工作的體認與專業能力。
本課程目標有三，一是在加強學生諮商實務能力，要求學生在諮商督導協助下，實際進入臨床實習情境進行個案諮商。學生要能針對個案問題及需求進行個案問題分析並選擇合宜策略以擬定諮商計劃，進而實際對個案進行諮商晤談，以其有效協助個案解決問題，增進學生諮商效能。
二是針對失落議題的悲傷輔導與諮商，亦能在實習過程中，獲得實務練習，增進悲傷諮商的知能與技術。
三是運用團體諮商的原理和技巧，強化學生的團體諮商實務能力。在督導協助下實際進行結構式團體的設計與帶領，以期有效協助團體成員因應其問題，從而增進實習學生帶領團體的諮商實際效能。
The course aims to enhance students’ ability to practice counseling under supervision. Furthermore, students will learn to assist clients’ solving their life difficulties by actually counseling clients.

本課程旨在使學生獲得執行獨立研究之能力。課程中，學生須與任課老師針對碩士論文有關之議題訂正進度報告及討論以達成學習目標。以漸進的方式導引學生，使學生能了解論文計畫之撰寫方式，並朝正確之方向閱讀相關文獻。透過個別討論、團體討論、學習及報告，確立研究問題，組織文獻考查，設計研究可行之研究方法。學生藉由討論與主題相關的課題以增進研究實務能力。
The purpose of this course is to assist student’s independent research ability in preparing the related issue of master thesis. The students enrolling this class are expected to make progress report and have discussion with the advisor in order to reach the learning goal. Teach students how to present a well-done dissertation with systematically research approaches and related references. The purpose of this course is to promote students’ capacity to design a research proposal. Students will be able to apply research knowledge and formulate a research proposal through individual and group discussion and assignments. Students will be able to identify a research problem, organize relevant literature, and design a feasible method for their study.

本課程目標在於針對無程式設計經驗的學生提供程式設計導論。本課程將使用 R 語言為主要程式工具，並以R Studio 平台作為程式設計的學習環境。透過專案實作與課堂演練，學生將學習如何處理資料科學當中的邏輯問題，並且理解 R 語言的實際運用與範疇。本課程希望鼓勵學生能學習如何以 R 語言撰寫程式，並且能藉由程式設計技巧而有助於個人的工作領域。
This course aims to provide an introduction to students with no prior
programming experience. We will use the R language as the major tool as well as the
RStudio environment for facilitating the learning process of programming. With
practical projects and hands-on exercises, students will learn how to solve the logical problems in data science, while understanding the breadth of the R language. The course strongly encourages students not only learn how to program with R but also seek how to use the programming skills for supporting their own work.

本課程旨在教授學生具有高等生物統計學的分析能力。強調生物統計學於健康照護臨床研究的應用，本課程以奠定學生具有資料收集、資料分析及統計報表解讀之能力，同時有能力評值學術期刊所發表的文章。課程內容包括：複習初階統計學之基本概念、連續資料數的統計分析(t 檢定、變異數分析、線性複迴歸、相關分析、重複測量變異數分析)、非連續資料數的統計分析、無母數統計分析等，並將教導學生撰寫程式語言，以培育學生在研究上的統計概念。
This course is designed for graduate students who have basic knowledge on biostatistics. Emphases are on basic understanding of biostatistics and its applications in the research. The course also covers some advanced statistical methods which are commonly used in the research addition to the knowledge of statistical methodology, the course puts emphasis on building up practical skill on statistical analysis and interpreting the results. Sessions include lectures and small workshops for discussion. The course aims to teach health care researchers the essential elements of research methodology and statistics.
全18週

Aging theory for the elderly health care
本課程旨在提供學生認識老化概念與常見健康議題、老化理論於高齡健康照護領域之應用。課程內容包括全球與台灣的高齡者健康現況、老化概念、生物科學/行為科學/社會科學/心理社會發展等老化理論於高齡照護之臨床實務與研究之應用。本課程藉由講述法、討論法、文獻導讀與分析，使學生能熟悉老化概念，並應用相關老化理論於高齡健康照護議題，進而提升高齡健康整體照護之能力。
This course aims to provide students with an understanding of the concept of aging and common health issues, and the application of aging theory in the field of health care for the elderly. The course contents include the global and Taiwan health status of the elderly, the concept of aging, the application of aging theories such as bioscience /behavioral science / social Science / sychosocial development in clinical practice and research of elderly care. Lecture and discussion will be used as the teaching strategies to improve the ability of overall health care for the elderly.

Integrated Dementia Care
本課程旨在提供學生認識以人為本的全人照護核心理念於失智照護領域之應用。課程內容包括失智症整合式照護模式與應用、失智症預防策略、失智症症狀處置與照護、失智症照顧者照顧困境與處置、分析與批判各類失智症照護之研究論文。本課程藉由講述法、討論法、研究論文導讀與分析，瞭解於失智症照護研究議題之應用，以提升學生失智照護之臨床實務能力。
This course aims to provide students with an understanding of the core concept of people-oriented holistic care and its application in the field of dementia care. The course contents include integrated health care model and application for the dementia, prevention strategy of dementia, treatment and care of dementia symptoms, care difficulties and management of caregivers with dementia, and analysis and criticism of research papers on dementia care. Lecture and discussion will be used as the teaching strategies to improve students' ability in dementia care.

Humanities, Technology, and Aging Society
本課程旨在培養學生思辨科技導入對高齡者健康照護的影響與效益之能力。課程內容關切使用者經驗，主題包括科技對高齡者的生活品質、健康管理、醫療照護行為、與服務使用行為等影響，以及科技應用對高齡者心理健康和社會參與的效益。期待學生能從不同角度探討智慧科技與數位醫療帶來的價值與挑戰，為未來導入智慧科技於高齡照護的方向奠定基礎。

The content focuses on user experience, and topics include the impact of technology on the quality of life, health management, health care behavior, and service utilization, as well as the benefits of technology application on the mental health and social participation of the elderly. It is expected that students can analyze and evaluate the value and challenges brought by technology and digital medicine from different perspectives, and lay the foundation for the future direction of introducing smart technology into elderly care.

Innovation Management in Elderly Industry
本課程旨在探討面對高齡化與全球快速變化的時代，高齡事業必須更重視創新管理活動，並藉由有效的管理創新活動，達成企業永續經營的目標。本課程設計結合「高齡產業」、「創新」與「管理」三大元素，涵蓋高齡事業的創新能力、創新策略與創新執行過程等議題的探討。藉由課程上的互動與創新議題的探索，啟發同學對創新有不同思考與對創新管理的理解。希望修習本課程後，同學具備創新管理的思維。

Organization Analysis
本課程旨在協助不同領域之研究生，獲得健康照護體系內相關機構之組織與管理的理論與技能及其應用。課程內容以組織理論為基礎，以管理的功能：規劃、組織、領導、控制及人、財、物、資源管理之矩陣為架構，介紹相關主題 (例如，組織管理理論、衛生政策與醫療照護體系、組織目標與計畫之訂定原則、預算及成本的概念、組織結構、人力資源的管理、參與決策、品質管制等)之理論面與實務面。使學生能對健康照護體系相關之組織與管理有一完整概要的認識，以開發自己的管理潛能
This course is designed to provide multidisciplinary students with in-depth knowledge and skills in organization and management theories and practices of health care organizations. Class discussions will be focused on the application of management principles and techniques in problem solving and decision making in a management matrix of four major management functions—namely planning, organizing, leading, and controlling of health care organizations, plus manager’s responsibilities in managing people, finance, material, and resources management. Major topics will be introduced, such as organizational theories of management, health care policy and system, organizational goals and planning, budget and cost, human resource management, decision making, and quality management. Students are expected to learn a complete knowledge in relating to management of health care organizations. Based on the training of this course, managerial potential of students will be inspired.

The objective of this course is to provide students with advanced methods of applied statistics in order for students to distinguish appropriate hypothesis tests of analyzing the health related research effectively. Students are trained to discuss and calculate real data examples of homework and to read journal papers. They are expected to have ability to communicate with statisticians, and have creative and logical thinking. Subjects taught in this course include (1) general concepts of applied statistics, (2) descriptive statistics, (3) analysis of variance (ANOVA) (F tests), (4) simple regression analysis and correlation, (5) multiple regression analysis and correlation, (6) chi-square tests, (7) logistic regression analysis. Other related topics will also be introduced.

01
Organizational social network analysis
GuanXi 雖是中國五千年傳統官場與商場文化中的重要一環，但西方國家在近幾十年來也發展出類似的觀念，這個與guanxi類似的觀念正是所謂的社會網絡觀點。本課程將以此觀點來探討組織現象與問題。
社會網絡包含一群節點(個人、群體、組織、社區或國家等)，透過特定的社會關係(如溝通關係、友誼關係、社會支持關係、資訊與知識的傳遞和分享關係、市場交易與競合關係等)所形成的連結(見附錄)。正式的組織結構(formal organizational structure)對於組織的正常運作雖是必要的，然而由組織成員透過特定的社會關係所形成的非正式組織結構(informal organizational structure)卻常是真正影響組織運作的主要因素。所以經由探討這些節點在組織社會網絡中的位置與其所屬網絡的結構特性，研究者可以更精確的描述、解釋、預測組織成員的思想、態度、與行為。
本課程將介紹如何以社會網絡典範(social networks paradigm)來檢視、分析、解釋與評估組織中所存在的非正式組織結構，並教導同學使用社會網絡分析工具（如UCINET, NetDraw, KeyPlayer, Pajek等電腦軟體）來蒐集、分析與詮釋社會網絡資料。
While formal organizational structure is essential for the daily operation of an organization, the emerging field of organizational social network directs our attention toward the informal aspects of the organizational structure.  Social ties among employees within an organization, although invisible, have been shown to have great impact on organizational behavior.
This course introduces the social networks paradigm and explains how organizational behavior can be conceptualized in this new light.  Students are expected to familiarize themselves with the fundamental concepts of social network analysis and the use of available tools for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting network data.
全18週

本課程內容主要分為二部份，第一部份先介紹個體經濟學的理論與方法； 第二部份係運用第一部份所介紹的理論與方法，進一步對健康經濟有關的幾個重 要課題，例如健康照護之需求理論、生產理論、醫師行為、醫院行為、長期照護 產業、醫藥產業及政府管制等，加以分析與解釋。

Seminar in Health Technology
本課程介紹了健康照護與資訊科技應用的知識、基礎設施、功能和工具。在實務個案中探討規劃和管理知識在健康照護工作中的應用，重點傳遞著健康科技研究概念框架以及更深層次的影響。課程將以照護技術為發展前提，藉由案例分享，讓學生了解目前健康科技議題之下的產業變革，並瞭解相關技術應用優勢，包括資訊系統、醫療科技以及照護專業等。期望同學藉由個案的閱讀、討論、分析、傾聽與反思的過程，培養健康科技應用決策所需的邏輯思維與知識，提昇同學對於未來研究與就業展的專業能力。
This course introduces the knowledge, infrastructure, functions, and tools of health care and information technology applications. Practical cases explore the application of planning and management knowledge to health care work, conveying the conceptual framework of health technology research and its deeper implications. The course content will begin with care technology, and through case sharing, students will learn about the changes in the industry under current health technology issues and understand the advantages of related technology applications, including information systems, medical technology, and the care profession. Through case reading, discussion, analysis, and reflection, students will be able to link theory and practice to enhance their understanding of health technology development. This course is designed to enhance students' understanding of the development of health technology. Through thorough exposure to health technology cases, course participants will become familiar with the logic, theories, and uses presented in the cases and understand the strengths, challenges, and limitations of the current industry development in the cases.

Statistical Methods for Evidence-based Medicine

Medical information system practice and special topics
這個課程是針對想要了解醫院資訊系統的一般具有計算機知識的學生。介紹醫學資訊學及醫院資訊系統相關議題，及醫學資訊領域的研究範圍。學生將學習如何捕獲，處理和應用醫療資訊。將學習資訊科學與醫學相關理論。計算機在醫學中的各種應用也將被討論，包括:政府醫療公衛資訊政策方向，遠距醫療的應用，醫療大數據的應用，疾病管控資訊系統，醫學影像資訊系統等應用。
當順利完成本課程後，將能夠：1.討論醫院資訊系統的類型及醫院資訊系統的主要優缺點，2.識別大多數醫院資訊系統中使用的電子病歷，3.討論在台灣及國際醫院中所使用不同的HIS的類型，4. 解釋醫院資訊系統的一般組織，5.描述醫療信息系統如何被醫護人員所使用，6.討論醫學資訊學的性質，影響，和未來發展。
This class is for students with a general knowledge of computers who want to know more about Hospital Information Systems. This course will Introduce to the range of research in the field of Medical Informatics. Students will learn how medical information can be captured, processed and applied. Related theories in information science and medicine will be taught. Various applications of computers in medicine will also be introduced.
When you successfully complete this lesson, you will be able to: 1. Discuss types of Hospital Information Systems the major advantages of Hospital Information Systems.  2. Recognize the electronic medical records used in most Hospital Information Systems.  3. Discuss types of HIS used for different hospitals in Taiwan. 4. Explain the general organization of Hospital Information Systems.  5. Describe how a Hospital Information System is used by health care staff.  6. Discuss the nature and impact of medical informatics.
全18週

Information Systems Planning
系統發展管理著重在系統規劃與設計之觀念的建立，藉由介紹系統開發理論的 背景知識、發展沿革，協助同學瞭解系統規劃設計的理論脈絡。課程重心以 EA 為核心，其為企業在整合業務及資訊科技面的考量後設計出的概念藍圖， 透過業務、應用、資料與技術上的規劃，有效的實現企業的目標。課程中也採 用流程建模工具，讓學生能夠以實務運作方式，建立其專業核心職能。同時為 了能結合實務，本課程也加入實務專家主導的習作與講演，以鏈結理論與產業 現況。最後，經由實務案例的演練，將理論與實作融合以提昇學習的成效。
Most complex systems today contain a great deal of software/digital components and are becoming even more complex in the future. However, software derivations are becoming the Achilles heel of complex system, while half of all large system projects are cancelled. The goals of this course are to

2.	Understand the global trend of ISP methods and developments.
3.	Use Enterprise Architecture to develop systems that fit organizational strategies.

本課程運用物聯概念及其技術核心，教導學生們如何將資通訊科技加入健康照護產業中，一方面讓學生們了解健康照護及物聯領域相關知識，另一方面則讓學生們實際動手施作物聯網結合健康照護應用的實務操作，並且從現代技術中導入AI解析未來智慧健康照護的未來應用及發展。
This course uses the concept of IOT and its technical core to teach students how to add information and communication technology to the health care industry. On the one hand, it allows students to understand the relevant knowledge of the field of health care and IOT, and on the other hand, it allows students to actually implement IOT combined healthcare applications, and introduces AI from modern technology to analyze the future applications and development of future smart health care.
全18週

01
Research Methods and Design in Information Management
本課程的內容訓練學生如何做一個科學性的研究，必須有一套訓練的方法，舉凡在如何尋找問題，如何解決問題，如何搜集資料，如何分析資料等都需要有一套嚴謹的方法論，最後介紹研究報告、論文之撰寫。
The purposes of this course are (1) to review research concept, include how to conduct a research, and the fundamental elements of doing a research, (2) to foster students research capability, include data collection and data analyzing, and finally to organize and report the research result, (3) encourage students share their knowledge and research experience. Also, this is a course that trains students to present an in-depth examination of an information management topic through the delivery of a professional seminar and to observe and listen to how scientific research is presented. Key skills promoted in this course are independent thinking, following international research procedures, oral and written exposition of academic research. 
After completion of this course students should be able to; take responsibility for his or her further knowledge development, using relevant scientific theories and methods from earlier researches, and independently written thesis project.

01
Fundamentals of Information Sciences
本課程介紹資訊科學的基本知識與方法，內容包括資訊科學定義、資訊科學與
醫療資訊、資訊科學與企業智慧、資訊科學方法論與建模(包括最佳化、決策分
析、模擬、迴歸分析、資料探勘、類神經網路)、資訊科學應用(包括文字與網
頁探勘、巨量資料分析)。為使學生對資訊科學研究有全面性的瞭解，除教師授
課外將輔以個案討論、範例實作，在分析模型方面，主要以Python/R/SPSS/SAS
進行資料分析與驗證，此外透過相關文獻閱讀可協助同學擬定研究方向，以落
實學習目標。
This course is designed to accomplish four objectives. The course will begin with
definition of information sciences (IS) and its relationship to medical informatics and
business intelligence. Second, the course will familiarize students with major procedures
in IS research, such as the formation of research problem, literature review, model building.
Third, the course will introduce a number of IS methodologies and applications such as
data mining, neural networks, regression analysis, text/web mining, knowledge
management, and intelligent systems. Finally, students propose a research proposal to
justify learning achievement.
全18週

Special Topics in Functional Muscle Fitness
這門課程將深入研究肌肉的生理學和功能，包括力量、耐力、柔韌性和協調性等。學生將了解肌肉在運動中的作用，以及它們對身體運作的重要性。課程將關注不同年齡、性別和生活方式的人群，以瞭解肌肉適能對健康和運動表現的影響。學生將研究功能性肌肉適能的評估方法和測量工具，並學習如何設計和實施適合不同需求的運動計畫。課程還將介紹運動和運動營養的關係，以最大程度地提高肌肉適能。
This course will provide an in-depth study of muscle physiology and function, including strength, endurance, flexibility, and coordination. Students will learn about the role of muscles in movement and their importance to the functioning of the body. Courses will focus on people of different ages, genders and lifestyles to understand the impact of muscular fitness on health and performance. Students will examine assessment methods and measurement tools for functional muscular fitness and learn how to design and implement exercise programs tailored to different needs. The course will also introduce the relationship between exercise and sports nutrition to maximize muscle fitness.

Advanced Biostatistics
本課程旨在增進學生詮釋與應用健康科學相關之進階統計方法的理論跟程式語法結合，同時協助學生具體分辨各種統計檢定方法的適用時機，輔以相關健康議題之文獻閱讀討論及 Python 等程式語言進行專業統計分析，引導學生操作或使用 SPSS、EXCEL、GraphPad 等分析與繪圖工具，以淺顯易懂方式作圖表呈現及詮釋。課程內容將著重於推論統計學的 t	 檢定、變異數分析、迴歸及相關分析、其他實用統計分析以及 Python 等程式語言進行專業統計分析，預期學生能具備建立程式語言的能力，並可應用程式語法做研究資料與數據統計分析。
The objective of this course is to provide students with advanced methods of biostatistics and programming language in order for students to distinguish appropriate hypothesis tests of analyzing the health-related research effectively. Students are trained to discuss and calculate real data examples of homework and to read journal papers. Subjects taught in this course include (1) general concepts of
biostatistics, (2) descriptive statistics, (3) t tests, (4) analysis of variance (ANOVA) (F tests), (5) regression analysis and correlation, (6) other practical statistical analysis, (7) Python programming languages.

Research on sports health
這門課程將研究運動對身體和心理健康的積極影響，包括心臟健康、骨骼健康、代謝健康、情緒健康和認知功能等。學生將探索運動的生理機制，以理解為什麼運動對健康有益。課程將涵蓋不同人群（如兒童、青少年、成人和老年人）的運動需求和建議，並探討如何設計個性化的運動計劃，以滿足不同年齡和健康狀況的需求。
This course will examine the positive effects of exercise on physical and mental health, including heart health, bone health, metabolic health, emotional health, and cognitive function. Students will explore the physiological mechanisms of exercise to understand why exercise is beneficial to health. The course will cover the exercise needs and recommendations for different groups of people (such as children, teenagers, adults and the elderly) and explore how to design personalized exercise programs to meet the needs of different ages and health conditions.

01
Stress and Health Studies
時代與世界俱變，新世代人們的世界永遠運轉地比舊世代人們的世界來得快，此一事實使現代人永遠要面對新社會的挑戰，隨之而來的便是無時無刻侵襲著人類生存的生活壓力。本課程教導學生瞭解和評估個人及社會的壓力源，學習如何管理這些壓力，進而利用這些壓力和善用各類放鬆技巧來降低生活的不確定性。
評估壓力之基礎在於能夠瞭解人性 (包括心智活動或心理歷程)，欲瞭解人性則必須探討生命哲學問題，西方與東方哲學之起源皆在於人對宇宙和自身環境之體驗與認識，瞭解哲學便可瞭解基本人性之所需與所求，進而可從哲學角度發展出各項實用的壓力評估方法，本課程以探討東方哲學之源《周易》為主，旨在簡介易經六十四卦之演變，並應用易經生生之理、動靜之道，以達到管理自身壓力與善用放鬆技巧之最終目的，並將之應用於多元族群與多元環境中。主要上課教材為易經及教師自編講義。
Time changes, so does our world.  A new world always runs faster than the old one.  The human beings have to face new challenge in different situations, in which coming along with the stress and pressure in every daily life.  The course can help students to understand the sources of stress in individuals and the society.  Students can learn how to manage the stresses, take advantage of them, and use different relaxation skills to reduce the uncertainties in life. 
Knowing the humanity is the foundation of evaluating pressures (including the mental activities or processes). In order to know the humanity people have to considering the human philosophy.  The western and eastern philosophy began with the experiences of knowing the universe and the environment. The more we know about philosophy, the more we understand what the humanity needs and seeks. Based on I-Ching, the students will learn the evolutions of the 64 trigrams and apply them into real lives. From the viewpoints of unique philosophy, we can develop practical evaluations in pressure-evaluating, and apply the related skills into various populations and situations.

01
Individual studies in Exercise Metabolism and Ergogenic/Health Supplements
本課程主要探討急性和長期運動訓練對代謝的影響，同時本課程也將探討運動期間脂肪、蛋白質代謝、碳水化合物代謝的交互作用的關係。第一個主題將圍繞在碳水化合物代謝、胰島素受體和葡萄糖轉運體等兩個最重要的蛋白質。其次，我們將進一步討論葡萄糖代謝的限速酶的主要途徑與調節，同時深入探討碳水化合物與脂質代謝過程與運動後的生理與生化機制。第三，本課程將討論運動過程中的蛋白質代謝。同時，運動期間的內分泌系統變化與運動代謝調節及適應反應也會在本課程討論。此外，我們也會探討運動對蛋白質合成的影響與運動營養補充時間的概念。最後，我們將整合運動訓練、常見的保健產品和運動增能劑對健康狀態、運動表現、增肌減脂的效益。
This course is designed for students interested in studying the effects of acute and chronic exercise on metabolism.  It will also integrate fat and protein metabolism with carbohydrate metabolism.  The first topics of discussion will center on the two most important proteins in carbohydrate metabolism, the insulin receptor and the glucose transporter.  Next, the regulation of the major pathways of glucose metabolism and their rate-limiting enzymes will be discussed.  Having established the biochemical mechanisms by which carbohydrate metabolism is controlled during and following exercise, lipid metabolism will be discussed and its interaction with carbohydrate metabolism.  The third section will involve the use of protein during exercise.  The effect of exercise on protein accretion will also be discussed along with the interaction of nutrient timing on this process.  Finally, the course will conclude by studying the effects of exercise training, health-oriented supplements, and exercise ergogenic aids on promoting overall health and the increases in muscle mass.

Psycholinguistics
本課程旨在幫助學生建立心理語言學領域的基礎知識，並熟悉本領域之相關議題。學生將學到語言使用者如何理解語言、產出語言、及習得語言，及其相關的認知歷程。學生亦有機會學習並運用本課程內容至臨床評估治療或語言學相關之領域。
Psycholinguistics stands at the crossroads of linguistics, psychology, computer science and neuroscience. This course aims to introduce basic issues in this interdisciplinary study that explores how human beings use languages. Topics to be covered in the semester include: (1) language comprehension, (2) language production and (3) language acquisition. Students will acquire basic understanding of important issues in psycholinguistics through literature review, class discussion, and writing of a research paper.

Child Language Development Research

Advanced Speech Acoustics
本課程目的為建立學生對聲學的進階知識與應用。課程將介紹和言語相關的進階聲學概念，包括聲源濾波理論、聲帶振動模型、聲道面積函數、言語分析、言語合成。學生將獲得相關的實物操作能力，包括熟悉使用跨平臺、多功能的語音分析電腦軟體 PRAAT。學生將會熟悉使用聲學方法進行和言語異常、聽力異常相關的研究。
This course will provide an overview of advanced principles and applications of acoustics for speech pathology and audiology. Students will develop an understanding of advanced concepts in speech acoustics, including the acoustic theory of speech production, models of vocal fold vibration, vocal tract area functions, various approaches of speech analysis, and speech synthesis. Students will acquire a working knowledge of a versatile cross-platform computer speech analysis and synthesis software, PRAAT. Students will be able to apply acoustical methods for research studies of speech and hearing disorders.

Digital Signal Processing for Speech and Hearing Science
本課程為一學期之研究所選修課程，重點為介紹聽力語言相關之數位訊號處理技術及其應用，課程設計希望能在數位訊號處理基礎之外，加強理論及實際應用的討論。教學內容包括：數位訊號處理之相關數學基礎、數位訊號系統、語音認知(Speech Perception)及心理聲學(Psychoacoustics)基礎、聽覺系統的感應知覺原理、例如聽覺系統的時間解析(Temporal Resolution)及聽覺模型(Auditory Pattern and Model)，語音分析及合成原理，語音辨識及語者辨識。並利用電腦軟體，
This course is a one-semester course. In the Fall semester of 2013, we will focus on the fundamentals of digital signal processing applied for speech and hearing science. The course is designed not to elaborate on the digital signal processing itself but to introduce the basic concepts of signal processing and its applications for speech and hearing science. This course can be used to support other courses for the technology point of view. We will discuss some basic signal processing theory and their applications. Some reading will be assigned to the students. Computer software is also used in this course. The students will review those tools and do some analysis and processing on the signals.

Research in Adult Communicative Disorders
本課程基礎為培養學生具有評估成人語言障礙個案之能力，並提供適切介入方案與報告撰寫。課程內容包含介紹語言功能之神經解剖構造，並進一步解釋各類障礙如失語症、失智症、漸進性失語症、右腦傷、廣泛性腦創傷之病理原因與語言特徵。並透過課堂講授與實際示範標準化測驗流程，讓學生得以鑑別診斷各類語言障礙患者，以提供適切之治療方案。課程後半為進階研究，引導研究生研析成人語言障礙前瞻性文獻，並實際應用單一個案研究於實證本位介入。
The basis of this course is to cultivate students' ability to evaluate adult speech disorder cases, provide appropriate intervention plans and report writing. The course content includes an introduction to the neuroanatomical structure of language function, and further explains the pathological causes and language characteristics of various disorders such as aphasia, dementia, progressive aphasia, right brain injury, and generalized brain trauma. Through classroom lectures and practical demonstrations of standardized testing procedures, students can identify and diagnose patients with various speech disorders and provide appropriate treatment plans. The second half of the course is advanced research, which guides graduate students to analyze prospective literature on adult language disorders and actually apply single case studies in evidence-based intervention.
全18週

Differential Diagnosis in Speech-Language Pathology
瞭解語言病理學之機制及臨床表現、語言病理學所可能遇到之評估及鑑別診斷，使具備實證基礎的語言、言語、吞嚥障礙評估及處置所需之專業技術，清楚語言病理學之介入方針。
能尊重溝通障礙之個案，建立全人關懷、尊重、同理心的專業倫理與服務態度，並瞭解聽語國際發展趨勢並養成社會參與及終身學習的精神
Speech and Language behavior is the most sophisticate communicating skill within human society. The ability arises from individual physical capability and acquired achievement of linguistic learning. There are various pathologic factors can compromise and distort the acquisition of this ability. The direct effect and the interaction of the these pathologic status will express different phenomenon of speech and language disorders. To learn and aware of these interaction is important for every speech and language therapist.

Fluency Disorders
語暢異常是指說話時的言語流暢度出現障礙。依症狀及成因可分為三個類型包括口吃、迅吃以及神經性口吃。其中以口吃最廣為人知，主要是說話的流暢度及韻律出現障礙，目前成因仍未知；迅吃的特點是語速過快，導致說話急促且含糊不清並伴隨過多不流暢，可能和異常的語言及思考過程有關；神經性口吃指後天形成的不流暢，常導因於神經性疾病。
This course is designed to provide a comprehensive introduction of fluency disorders regarding etiology, diagnosis, and treatments. Additional skills including consulting, strategies applying, 
evidence-based practicing in treatment efficacy are applied.

Studies in Emergent Literacy
本課程目地為建立碩士學生之兒童讀寫萌發概念及如何促進兒童閱讀能力之實物操作能力。範圍包括兒童的讀寫發展、早期讀寫經驗(early literacy experiences ) 及讀寫知識 (literacy knowledge)。研究範圍包括1. 如何有效的與兒童共讀繪本、2.父母在家裡如何提供閱讀經驗及、3.社會文化對閱讀的價值觀。同時也探討兒童如何從這些經驗逐漸萌發對讀寫的興趣，漸漸累積建立整體的讀寫知識，這些早期讀寫知識包括：1.文字符號系統的知識、2.對母語語言聲音音韻的覺察認識、3. 理解語言文
This course is designed to provide students with an overview of the research in the early literacy. Three major areas are discussed, including the development of early literacy, the literacy experiences and the literacy knowledge.

Child Care Issue Around The World
本課程旨在探究世界主要國家在學前幼兒的教育和保育的相關議題。其中又以美、英日德芬蘭、瑞典、紐澳等國家為主，探究各國之學前幼兒教育和保育相關制度與政策，以及遭遇到的問題與困境。透過比較教育的研究方法，分析比較各主要國家的學前教保議題。
The course is aimed to explore child care service around the world, including the basic
knowledge and theories of child care service, issues of the changes of family function and child
care services for children aged from 0?12. To be specific, the content includes issues of the changes
of family function and child care needs, models of sharing child care responsibilities, the
development of childcare services, the characteristics of child care services, family policy and child
care policy, international comparison of family and child care services. In addition, this course
includes development and trends of child care policy and laws, and international comparison of
child care policies.Students are expected to have a comprehensive understanding of child care servicesaround the world and acquire abilities to discuss child care issues.

Advanced Statistics in Social Science
本課程旨在增進學生詮釋與應用健康科學相關之統計方法。課程設計運用實際資料分析的經驗，使學生能了解統計應用之意義，並激發學生研究之興趣。課程內容包括社會統計學之概念與方法，各類統計模式、統計分析之技術、統計圖之使用及製作、統計軟體SPSS之操作學習與資料分析之應用等。強調學生能從實際資料分析之經驗中，使其能應用適當之統計方法，解決專業上的各種研究問題。
The course is designed to provide an education that students will understand and interest the specialty of social statistics, and foster ability for independent thinking and solving problems. This course contents include statistical graphs, summary Statistics, probability distribution, significant tests, ANOVA (one way and two way), regression analysis (simple and multiple regression), model selections, design of questionnaire, factor analysis, reliability, and nonparametric approaches.

Special Issues in Early Childhood Education and Care Services
課程之宗旨為培養學生以文件分析法探討有關幼兒教育及照顧、兒童福利、兒童托育服務等之政策、法規、社會事件等相關議題。本課程閱讀的文件以經濟合作暨發展組織（簡稱:經合組織：Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development，OECD）A Quality Toolbox for Early Childhood Education and Care-III，如何提升一個國家的教保生態達到優質的境界為主軸，並探討2011年我國幼托整合後在嬰幼兒教保政策、課程、教保人員的資格與薪資福利、家園社區的合作、研究與輔導及評鑑等政策的實施至今與OECD的標準比較。以及從達到教保優質的水準，我國幼托政策的可能的作為為何？
It is important to recognize the trend of development of early childhood education and care from the concepts of OECD. The aim of the course is to analyze Taiwan’s early childhood education from the views of OECD. Thus the purposes of the course are: to explore the evolution of educare services;recognize the significances and functions of educare services;investigate the types of as well as delivery and management systems of domestic child care services;analyze child care service policies; and to understand trends in international child care services
Course contents include the research papers, articles and all kinds of documents related to educare services.
Since most of the materials are written in English, it is required all the students need to familiar with the materials before they attend the class.

Design of Teaching Materials and Use of Multimedia
本課程採循序漸進的方式，從多媒體設計流程的架構進行介紹，讓學生掌握多媒體設計與多媒體互動的技術，同時也能從實作中學到完整的互動式醫護教育多媒體開發流程與觀念。課程目標是希望能讓同學能夠將教案轉換成互動式多媒體形式呈現，並學會如何創作醫護領域課程之互動多媒體教材。修完這門課之後，學生將具備互動式醫護教育多媒體設計與開發的技能，並且提昇製作數位教材的能力。
This course introduces the basic concept and design method of interactive e-book design. The goal of the course is to enable students to convert lesson plans into interactive materials and learn how to create material for health care courses. After completing this course, students will have the ability to design interactive multimedia materials, and enhance the ability to produce digital teaching materials.

01
Seminar on  Information and online Resources
本課程透過講授、示範與實作，介紹與應用教育研究與教材創作二類之資訊與網路資源。教育研究部份會介紹引文分析、書目管理與期刊影響等工具資源，以期讓同學具備文獻搜集、整理與評析之能力，進而提昇論文研究之品質與效率。而教材創作部份則會概要的介紹數位教材創作常用的資源與工具，以期讓同學需發展研究所需之教材與工具時，能有效率的尋找與評估資源與工具。
This course introduces and applies information and online resources related to two main areas: educational research and instructional material creation. In the educational research segment, we cover topics such as citation analysis, reference manager, journal impact, and the ChatGPT. The aim is to equip students with the ability to collect, organize, and critically evaluate literature, thereby enhancing the quality and efficiency of their research papers. As for the instructional material creation segment, we provide an overview of the commonly used resources and tools for digital content creation. This is to ensure that when students need to develop materials and tools for their research, they can efficiently find and assess the necessary resources and tools.
全18週

01
Advanced Biostatistics
本課程將奠定學生具有進階應用生物統計學的分析能力，引導學生根據研究目的，選擇正確的統計分析方法，並且在分析之後，能夠描述及解釋與分析的結果，將所得的數字結果轉換成有意義的文字解釋，並學習如何透過統計數據來解釋相關的問題與現象，同時必須學會如何閱讀和批判量化或實證的文獻或研究。課程內容包括：基本機率論、機率分佈理論、統計估計及檢定(獨立樣本及成對樣本 t-test)、變異數分(ANOVA)、相關係數、簡單迴歸分析到複迴歸分析等議題。本課程將會使用 SPSS 等專業統計軟體之操作。
The objective of this course is to provide graduate students with the advanced knowledge and understanding of the methods of statistical analysis applicable to medical and nursing research. Also, this course is directed to equip graduate students with advanced capability of applying statistical analysis. The course is 'math-lite but operation-heavy' emphasizing concepts and application of statistical thinking and application. Probability theory, parametric statistics, correlation, regression, ANOVA, correlation analysis and regression analysis along with computer package practice 
(SPSS) will be introduced.
全18週

Theories of Allied Health Education and Digital learning
本課程旨在增進學生對醫護數位學習理論的了解及其在醫護領域的應用，內容包括：學習理論之發展史、影響學習之相關因素及重要學習理論之背景、內涵及應用、數位學習發展與應用、數位學習平台系統、學習面與教學面，期使學生能對醫護數位學習理論有更深入的認識，並能分析醫護數位學習理論於醫護領域之應用。
This course is designed to provide students with learning experiences that will facilitate students to understand the theories of health allied E-learning and their application to school, curriculum, and teaching revolution. The units of this course include the learning theories (conditioning theories, social cognitive theory, cognitive information processing theory, cognitive learning processes, constructivist theory, neuroscience of learning), application of E-learning, teaching and learning in E-learning, and how to use LMS and LCMS. The students will be enhanced with concepts about the theories of health allied E-learning, and analyze their application in the theories of health allied E-learning.
全18週

Curricular & Teaching Evaluation in Allied Health Education
本課程旨在增進學生對課程評鑑與教學評量的理解與應用，內容包括課程評鑑的概念、模式與方法、教學評量的概念、紙筆測驗命題技巧、試題分析、實作評量、檔案評量及臨床能力評量等。教學/學習方法包括講述、討論、文獻評析、口頭與書面報告等，學生須配合醫護教育實習，獨力完成一份課程評鑑與一份教學評量報告。
This course aims to enhance students' understanding and application of curricular and instructional evaluation in allied health education. The course contents include the concepts of curricular evaluation and educational assessment, test construction and item analyses, performance evaluation, portfolio evaluation and clinical competence assessment. Multiple teaching methods are composed of lectures, discussions, articles reading, oral and written reports. Students will applied the learned knowledge and skills in writing a curricular evaluation and report. Students will plan, conduct, and report an evaluation study of a curricular program and an instructional evaluation.
第1~5,16週

Nurse-Midwifery Practicum Ι
此課程旨在協助學生發展專業助產的能力，統整並能運用相關學理，增進助產臨床照護低危險妊娠經驗，實習內容於婦產科門診實施產前檢查、身體評估、健康指導、子宮頸抹片檢查、產後檢查等。
This course is designed to prepare nurses for specialization in midwifery practice. 01
Reproductive Physiology and Pathology
本課程旨在探討人類生殖生理學的原理與機轉，及婦女孕育過程中的醫療處置及其機轉和最新趨勢，課程內容包括生殖系統解剖構造與功能、生殖內分泌調節、月經週期、受精與著床、胎盤發育與功能、胎兒發育與生長、懷孕期的免疫與生理調適、基因與遺傳疾病以及分娩與泌乳，及妊娠與內外科合併症、不正常分娩、羊水栓塞、分娩與麻醉。藉由課室教學與討論使學生熟悉生殖生理的原理與機轉，並且能應用於臨床實務以及研究當中。
The aims of this course are to present the principles and mechanisms of reproductive physiology and pathology. The contents include the structures and functions of reproductive system, regulation of reproductive endocrine, menstrual cycles, fertilization and implantation, the development and function of the placenta, the development and growth of embryo, immunological aspects and physiological adaptation of pregnancy, genetic disorders, parturition and lactation, preconceptional counseling and prenatal care, prenatal diagnosis and antepartum assessment, intrapartum assessment & management of abnormal labor, newborn assessment and resuscitation, assisting initiation of breastfeeding, the puerperium and possible complication, pregnancy hypertension, gestational diabetes mellitus, fetal growth disorder, multifetal gestation, obstetric hemorrhage (antepartum and postpartum), postterm pregnancy and induction of labor, and medical and surgical disease complicating pregnancy.
  Through selected topics and discussion, students will understand advanced reproductive physiology and pathology, then will be able to apply the knowledge in clinical practice and the research.
全18週

Health Assessment and Practice
本課程旨在增強學生臨床實務相關評估之學理與技巧。課程內容著重於應用焦點病史訪談、心理與生理評估技巧、詮釋評估結果於各年齡層之個案。學生應用臨床邏輯思維和鑑別診斷之模式，針對個案之健康問題主訴，應用相關學理與技巧，進行焦點評估、分析與正確的鑑別診斷個案之健康問題，以達成課程的目標。
The purpose of the course is to advance students' physical assessment theory and skills that related to professional clinical nursing practice. The content of the course is emphasized on application skills of client interview, physiological and psychological assessment, interpreting results in women throughout the life span. Applying theories and techniques, assessing, analyzing and diagnosing health problems of a selected client will accomplish the course objectives.
全18週

Childbirth Education
本課程旨在協助學生成為專精之生產教育指導者，課程重點包括（1）具備懷孕、生產、產後婦女及其家庭變化及需求的正確理念及生產教育者的角色功能，（2）統整及應用課程設計、團體動力、諮商、賦權、創意/批判性思考等理論於生產教育實務，（3）討論/批判相關研究文獻並應用研究成果。教學方法將以互助及經驗分享式之學習為主，學生將以教學方案展現專精之生產教育能力
This course is designed to prepare students for training as a childbirth educator. The content includes (1) professional role of the childbirth educator; (2) promoting a safe and healthy pregnancy and birth; (3) assisting women and their families to make informed decisions for childbearing; (4) providing information and support that encourages attachment between babies and their families; (5) assisting women and their families to discover and to use strategies to facilitate normal, natural, and healthy pregnancy, birth, breastfeeding, and early parenting. (6) design, teach, and evaluate a course in childbirth preparation that increases a woman’s confidence and ability to give birth.

This course is designed to assist students acquiring clinical expertise in midwifery care of women during the childbirth process. In this course, students are required to select a problem or an issue discussed in the seminar and completes the nursing process through integration and application of the theories for selected women during childbirth process in appropriate clinical settings. Students are expected to develop a preliminary conceptual model to explain a clinical phenomenon involving women and its implications in nursing. Problem solving and critical thinking skills of students will be enhanced by employing the learning contract teaching strategy in the course.

Meridians and Acupoints
本課程旨在協助學生瞭解經絡俞穴之實證研究與實證實務，期使學生
能在實證之理論與研究上有所認識，而應用於臨床有關健康照護，以增進
學生健康照護之護理實證實務能力。課程內容包含介紹經絡俞穴實證研究
現況，並教導臨床實務常用之經絡穴位護理介入方法，使學生能增強中西
醫結合精準護理專業之實證能力。
This course aims to enable students to understand the empirical research and 
practical verification of meridians and acupoints. It is hoped that students can 
have an understanding of the empirical theory and research, and apply it to 
clinical health care, so as to enhance the students' health care ability in 
practical nursing. The course content includes introducing the current status of 
empirical research on meridians and acupoints and teaching the commonly used 
nursing interventions in clinical practice so that students can enhance the 
empirical ability of the precision nursing of integrated traditional Chinese and 
western medicine.

Diagnosis of Chinese Medicine
本課程旨在讓學生熟悉中醫診斷的基本概念與臨床常用診斷方法。主要學習經驗包括望、聞、問、切四診之傳統及現代化的研究方法，八剛辨證、六經辨證、衛氣營血辨證之診斷標準的熟悉。使學生能習得中醫的診斷、增進觀察能力，並且結合現代護理診斷的觀察與記錄，瞭解病患疾病的特質，以為選擇中西醫最佳治療方法。
This course attempts to familiarize students with the fundamental concepts and clinical diagnostic methods of Traditional Chinese Medicine. Inspection, Ausculation, Interrogation, Pulse Taking, and Palpation will assist us to collect comprehend many numerous signs and symptoms of the patients. In addition, eight principal syndromes for diagnosis, five zang-organs, six fu-organs, and theory of the Six Channels, Wei-Qi-Ying and Xue Systems included. These will promote the diagnostic abilities of the students. We combine Chinese-Western nursing diagnostic methods to obtain more information from the patient. This will be an essential basis from which to choose the best practices from both Modern and Traditional Chinese treatments.

Advanced Biostatistics
本課程以教授研究所學生具有進階應用生物統計學的分析能力。強調生物統計學之應用與醫學及護理臨床研究結合，以奠定學生具有資料收集、資料分析及統計報表解讀之能力，同時有能力評值學術期刊所發表的文章。課程內容包括：基本機率論、機率分佈理論、統計估計及檢定(獨立樣本及成對樣本t-test)、變異數分析(ANOVA)、相關係數、簡單迴歸分析到複迴歸分析等議題。本課程將會使用SPSS等專業統計軟體之操作。
The objective of this course is to provide graduate students with the advanced knowledge and understanding of the methods of statistical analysis applicable to medical and nursing research.  Also, this course is directed to equip graduate students with advanced capability of applying statistical analysis.  The course is 'math-lite but operation-heavy' emphasizing concepts and application of statistical thinking and application. 本課程主要學習目標，在於讓學生瞭解中醫之針灸與傷科基礎理論與其實務應用。課程內容包括中醫針灸與傷科概論、經絡學、腧穴學、針灸治療原理與原則、針灸常見疾病之辨證施護、傷科基礎理論、傷科診斷與治療、傷科基本手法、頸肩與腰背痠痛護理腰等。課程目標將培育學生能奠定針灸與傷科護理之基礎理論與實務操作能力，並能應用於健康暨疾病照護。
The main learning objective of this course is to enable students to understand the basic theory and practice of acupuncture and traumatology of traditional Chinese medicine. The course content includes the introduction of acupuncture and traumatology, the principles of meridian, acupuncture points as well as moxibustion, the syndrome differentiation and nursing care to common acupuncture-related diseases, the principle of traumatology, the diagnosis and therapy of traumatology, and musculoskecullar adjustment manipulations for neck, shoulder, and back pain. This course aims to cultivate students' capabilities of the foundational theoretical and practical skills of acupuncture and traumatology, which can be applied to health and disease care.
全18週

本課程旨在使學生瞭解資訊科技於健康照護應用的評值基本概念，了解使用者、管理者、及設計者的科技評值考量。課程內容包含評估健康資訊科技應用的重要性與範疇、評值應用資訊科技的概念架構、資訊系統設計與評值、機構規範的因應策略、人機介面的測試、設計評量使用成效的指標與方法、影響科技使用的相關因素。
The course is a continuum of the adult health nursing I. The purposes of the course include (1)advance professional clinical competence in adult health nursing; and (2) training student performing role and function of nurse specialist or advanced nurse practitioner in adult health nursing. The course objectives will be accomplished by demonstrating actual roles and responsibilities of advanced nurse practitioner or specialist, and competence in completing a related project.
全18週

01
Data Management and Statistical Analysis in Medical Research
本科目於教學設計上，乃著眼於資料庫管理與統合各種量性資料分析方法之實務操作，目標在於提昇學生管理與分析統計相關資料之能力。課程中將運用SPSS統計套裝軟體來學習以下統計資料管理與分析策略：1)建立資料庫檔案並進行資料庫檔案之增刪、編輯與修改；2)著手分析健康照護相關之研究資料、繪製資料圖表;3)運用描述性與推論性統計策略;4)撰寫研究資料之分析結果。整體而言，選修本課程之學生，將透過課程講授、實際練習操作統計套裝軟體及實例研討等方法，落實學習統計資料之管理與分析。
The objective of this course is to provide students with practical applications of bio-statistical methods by running the SPSS statistical software. Two sample data (depression data and factor analysis data) in the health related agendas will demonstrate and analyze effectively. Major topics and headings will include (1) overview of SPSS statistical software, (2) data arrangement (3) descriptive statistics, (4) analysis of variance, (5) simple regression analysis and correlation, (6) multiple regression analysis and correlation, (7) category data analysis, (8) logistic regression analysis, and (9) repeated measurement based on the applied consideration of medical science. The advance ability toward the management of quantity data will be the core of teaching plan and interactive procedure. The aims of this course are to promote and reinforce students actually understand the whole-spectrum of basic statistics and its practical directions.
全18週

01
Academic Writing
本課程旨在引導學生以邏輯性的科學思維運用對於生物醫學與護理本職學能之背景在醫學研究倫理之原則下架構研究問題、形塑研究假說、收集並歸納研究議題相關之背景知識與現存之科學證據，進而對於現有之科學證據進行系統性之評析與回顧，評斷先前所提出之臨床問題之合宜性，並以科學原則修正。本課程將運用實例與習作使學生對於此一往復的過程有所了解與熟悉，配合適切的研究設計與分析方法探究所設立之科學假說。本課程將引導學生基於上述之科學原則以符合學術研究倫理之方式適切的撰寫學術文章。課程綜合了科學邏輯、研究原理、文獻評讀、實證歸納與分析以及科學寫作方法。內容大綱包括：以科學方法建構研究議題，包含資料庫搜尋、資料查詢與資訊萃取的方法與實作、學術性文獻評析之科學文獻回顧與統整，以及學術論文寫作相關的研究倫理與實例探討。
This course aimed at guiding the class attendants to formulate practical problems into study propositions and hypothesis with the emphasis on scientific and logical principles. The course attendants will lean the methods on collecting and summarizing the current available evidence focused on the study issue based on which a systematic critique and revision on proposed proposition will be formed. The principles of academic writing will be illustrated by using a series of examples to help the attendant to draft the study proposal. The course will integrate the scientific rationale, literature review, study design, and statistical analysis to shed light on academic writing for study proposal.
全18週

01
Family in Crisis: Theory and Intervention
此課程旨在增進學生照顧家庭的專業能力，主要是與健康問題有關的家庭危機。此課程中將評估和分析急性、慢性生病及有障礙行為對家庭單位的衝擊，學生將分析和發展家庭危機行為處置模式，在行為處置模式中將包括文化、價值、家庭信念、和行為、家庭壓力及危機等重要概念。
This course is designed to assist students acquiring clinical expertise in the nursing 
care of family in crisis with specified health problem. In this course, the impact of acute, 
chronic illness and disruptive behavior on family units will be assessed and analyzed. 
Students are expected to analysis and develop behavioral intervention models. A variety 
of cultural values, family beliefs and behaviors, in addition to, family stress and crisis 
are incorporated into behavioral interventions.

Independent Study
本課程以個別指導之形式，依據碩士生之護理專長背景及未來專業發展方向，引導學生探索相關核心概念、理論，結合其臨床專業技能，應用批判性思考及實證護理的概念，訂定研究方向及主題，擬定研究設計、完成研究計畫之書寫。

本課程以個別指導之形式，依據碩士生之護理專長背景及未來專業發展方向，引導學生探索相關核心概念、理論，結合其臨床專業技能，應用批判性思考及實證護理的概念，訂定研究方向及主題，擬定研究設計、完成研究計畫之書寫。
This course is delivered in an individualized format, tailored to the nursing specialization and future professional development of the master's student. It guides students in exploring relevant core concepts and theories, integrating their clinical expertise, applying critical thinking and evidence-based nursing concepts, determining research directions and topics, and developing research designs, culminating in the completion of a research proposal.
全18週

Nursing Information Managemetn II
本課程的目的在提升學生暸解資訊科技在健康照護機構的應用及推展過程。學生可暸解資訊科技發展的策略計畫、機構組織改變及健康照護上的應用狀況及其相關議題。課程內容包括資訊科技推動策略的應用、組織的改變過程、資訊科技的整合、資訊科技推動成效及相關議題，旁及於健康資訊隱私及安全議題之探討。
The purpose of this course is to assist students in identifying the major concepts information management within healthcare organizations. Students will be able to understand the application of information technology on strategic planning in consultation, organizational change process, care transformation and evolution, the development of and the evaluation of care outcome. Issues of nursing ingormation management and data privacy and patient safety will be explored as well.
全18週

Practicum of Nursing Information Managemetn II
此課程的目的使學生透過科技應用的專案模式，瞭解實習機構中推動護理資訊系統的過程，並探討資訊科技運用於健康照護的成果或專案管理的議題。同時能運用實證文獻，提出資訊科技於特定護理領域應用的相關研究議題。
This course offers students an opportunity to synthesize their information nursing management knowledge and apply it on their interested clinical field for quality improvement. Learning activities include developing a project management process of any technology use for outcome measurement, staff management or usage experiences. Students will explore related research issues in system design and development, project management, user experiences,healthcare process and organizational management.

Advanced Applied Biostatistics
本課程以教授研究所學生具有進階應用生物統計學的分析能力。強調生物統計學之應用與醫學及護理臨床研究結合，以奠定學生具有資料收集、資料分析及統計報表解讀之能力，同時有能力評值學術期刊所發表的文章。課程內容包括：基本機率論、機率分佈理論、統計估計及檢定(獨立樣本及成對樣本t-test)、變異數分析(ANOVA)、相關係數、簡單迴歸分析到複迴歸分析等議題。本課程將會使用SPSS等專業統計軟體之操作。
Biostatistics plays an essential role in all stages of a quantitative health care research from design through to analysis and interpretation. This course covers the essential principles and methods required for a master degree. Emphasis is on study design, appropriate analysis, software application (SPSS) and interpretation of results. The underlying concepts of statistical analysis are covered. Sessions include lectures and practical work, both computer-based and using small workshops for discussion.
The course aims to teach health care researchers the essential elements of research methodology and statistics. The focus is mainly on interpretation and understanding appropriate methodology.
全18週

Health promotion and management
本課程主要協助學生瞭解健康促進與管理之實務層面與其相關研究，期使學生能在健康促進與管理之理論與實務有所認識，而應用於臨床有關健康促進與管理層面之照護，以增進學生健康照護之能力。課程內容包含健康促進與管理相關之理論與研究以及實務層面之見習，例如：健康促進與管理之相關理論、體重管理之機轉，評值、體重過重與過輕對健康之影響，與疾病相關之影響、兒童肥胖與更年期肥胖、各種健康管理之策略、臨床健康管理週課程見習。
This course provides students to have the basic concepts of health promotion and management for health care. The major focus of the course encompasses: Introduction(Prevalence, evaluation of body composition) Etiology and health impact of obesity and underweight Obesity related disease: Metabolic syndrome, health management related problem in menopausal women, Health problems in Abnormal weight during childhood, Clinical approach of weight management, Nutritional strategies of weight management , Exercise strategies of management , Comparison of variant diet of health promotion and management: evidence based approach Visiting clinics 1(including exercise practice and diet preparation practice) ,Obesity treatment: medical, surgical and herbal preparation , Behavior approach of health promotion and management, E-health management. Students present their understanding of the health issues about health promotion and management through the participation and discussion in the class.

Adult Practice Nursing II
本課程旨在培育成人專科護理師學生具備急性醫療特定疾病病人之進階知識與技能，並加強其對對專科護理師角色、功能與執業議題之瞭解。課程強調運用批判性思維與實證醫學和護理，以建立適當之健康問題診斷、處置和評價照護結果之學習。透過講述、學生課堂導讀、案例分析、小組討論、角色扮演、影片情境分析與數位平台討論等多元教學策略，訓練學生批判性思考、溝通與自學能力，並培養學生具備成人專科護理師入門所需之知識與技能，使其能以專科護理師的角色提供急性醫療特定疾病病人適切之進階護理照護。
This course provides the student with in-depth knowledge of advanced nursing management of complicated and acutely ill adults. Emphasis is on the utilization of critical thinking and evidence-based practice to formulate diagnoses and management and evaluation plans of care for physiologically unstable and complicated adult patients who have multiple complex health problems, and are at high risk for developing complications.  The focus is on the management of specific system problems of acute care. This course provides students with advanced knowledge necessary to deliver advanced nursing care in acute care settings.

Adult Practice Nursing II - Practicum
本課程旨在培育成人專科護理師學生，具備急性醫療嚴重病人照護之進階知識與技能，並加強其對對專科護理師執業議題之瞭解。實習課程強調運用批判性思維與實證醫學和護理，以建立適當之健康問題診斷、處置和評價照護結果於所照護之個案。透過實習契約書之訂定、實習指導教師與實習教學教師的共同輔導、實習日誌、個案報告、互動記錄、臨床照護指引、教案與實習心得的完成，以確保學生的實習經驗，至實習結束每位學生將至少照護十位內外科急性醫療嚴重病人，以培養學生具備成人專科護理師所需之知識與技能，使其能以專科護理師的角色提供病情嚴重之急性醫療病人適切之進階護理照護。
The course is a continuum of the clinical practicum for adult health nursing I. The purposes of the course are (1) to train students’ competencies in assessing, diagnosing, examining, and managing common medical and surgical health problems, (2) to facilitate students’ consultation ability for emotional responses of acute ill patients, (3) to cultivate students’ case management ability, (4) to increase students’ communication and collaboration to achieve excellent care, and (5) to be familiar with ethical and legal issues affecting NP practice in Taiwan.. Within the practicum, student will demonstrate actual roles and responsibilities of an acute care nurse practitioner.

Health Care of Elderly II
此課程旨在透過對老人健康照護政策、管理、策略及社區發展的理論、研究與議題研討，增進學生對老人照護相關之管理、領導、教育、諮商等能力。學生需統整及應用老人健康照護、經濟、主要照顧者、社會支持、組織發展等理論研究於實務情境中，發揮其個案管理及團體照護之功能，並需獨立針對特定議題完成專案以展現其老人照顧專家的角色功能，並展現其統合資源建立社區網絡之能力。
This course is designed to cultivate students’ abilities on management, leadership, education, and consultant of elder care services, based on the theories of elder policy, management, strategy, and community development. Students have to integrate the theories of elder health, economy, caregiver, social support, organizational development, etc., and apply into the real situations. Students are expected to express the roles and function of case management and group care, to implement and evaluate health care project for elder groups, and to synthesis community resources.
全18週
